0.title: IMD predicts heavy rain in B'luru for next 2 days, says worst not over yet
0.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy rainfall in Bengaluru for the next two days and said that the "worst is not over yet". According to the weather office, the city recorded 251.4 mm of rain in the last four days. Bengaluru witnessed 131.6 mm of rainfall on Sunday, the highest 24-hour precipitation in September in 34 years, IMD said.

1.title: There will always be professional critics: Cong's Jairam on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
1.article_body: Reacting to the BJP's criticism of the party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress' Jairam Ramesh said the party has only one vision right now, which is to ensure the successful completion of the yatra. "There will always be professional critics, arm-chair critics and people who will raise questions in India for everything you do," Ramesh added.

2.title: Started business of selling & buying phones at 14: Zerodha's billionaire Co-founder Nikhil
2.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire Co-founder Nikhil Kamath revealed that he started a business of buying and selling phones at the age of 14 with his friend and soon after dropped out of school. Nikhil said that at the age of 17 he bagged a job at a call centre that paid him ₹8,000 and at 18, he began trading stocks properly.

3.title: 19-year-old gives birth to twins from two different fathers in Brazil
3.article_body: A 19-year-old Brazilian woman gave birth to twins from two different fathers. The woman said she had intercourse with two men on the same day. Her doctor said, "It is possible to happen when two eggs from the same mother are fertilised by different men. The babies share the mother's genetic material, but they grow in different placentas."

4.title: Innovative, high-potential vaccine: Dr VK Paul on nasal COVID-19 vaccine
4.article_body: After Bharat Biotech's nasal COVID-19 vaccine got approval for primary immunisation against COVID-19 in 18+ age group for restricted use in emergency situation, NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul said India has set an example before world by developing the "innovative and high-potential" vaccine. "This is another tool to fight against COVID-19...This is a story of self-reliance...self-confidence," he added.

5.title: If content isn't good, the film doesn't work: Ranbir on 'Shamshera'
5.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, speaking about the boycott trend against him, has said that he did not feel negativity when his film 'Shamshera' had released. "If the film didn't run at the box office, it's only because the audience didn't like the film. Eventually, it's about the content," the 'Brahmastra' actor added. 'Shamshera' also featured Vaani Kapoor and Sanjay Dutt.

6.title: It was a great experience: Shubman Gill on 92(148) on county debut
6.article_body: India batter Shubman Gill, who's currently playing for Glamorgan in the County Championship Division Two, scored 92 off 148 balls on his debut in the tournament. "It was a great experience for me...the conditions are different to back home, especially with the rain," said Gill. "Disappointed to be out on 92, but pretty satisfied with my performance," he added.

7.title: Mumbai reports 316 new COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths
7.article_body: Mumbai reported 316 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 11,47,041 cases, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said on Wednesday. The city saw three deaths due to the infection, taking the overall toll to 19,714. As many as 17 more patients were hospitalised, while the number of active cases stood at 2,218.

8.title: 4 arrested after attack on history-sheeter in Pune hospital
8.article_body: Four people have been arrested after they attacked 35-year-old history-sheeter Tushar Hambir, who was undergoing treatment at Pune's Sassoon Hospital on Monday, said police. Two persons, including a policeman, were injured in the incident. The attack was the result of a gang rivalry, according to police. One of the attackers tried to shoot Hambir but the weapon malfunctioned, said police.

9.title: IMD issues orange alert for Hyderabad till Sunday; many areas waterlogged
9.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an orange alert for Hyderabad until Sunday (September 11) predicting heavy rain in the city. Meanwhile, several areas of Hyderabad including Banjara Hills, Khairatabad faced severe waterlogging on Wednesday. "Movement of traffic is slow from North Zone, YMCA, SBH X Roads, Paradise X Roads towards Anand Theatre," the traffic police said on Thursday.

10.title: Centre approves ₹27,360 cr to develop schools under PM-SHRI scheme
10.article_body: Centre on Wednesday approved a ₹27,360 crore Pradhan Mantri Schools For Rising India (PM-SHRI) scheme for the upgradation of 14,500 schools across the country. The total project includes a central share of ₹18,128 crore for the period of five years from 2022-23 to 2026-27. The school selection process will involve three stages with definite timelines.

11.title: India reports 6,395 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 50,342
11.article_body: India has reported 6,395 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 5,379 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 50,342, while the death toll has risen to 5,28,090, according to the latest data.

12.title: Man pretending to be Andhra MP's PA breaches Amit Shah's security during Mumbai visit
12.article_body: A man who claimed to be the personal assistant of an MP from Andhra Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly breaching the security of Home Minister Amit Shah during his two-day visit to Mumbai. Police said Hemant Pawar, 32, was seen moving around Shah and other politicians at Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis's official residence on Monday.

13.title: Gulf states warn Netflix to remove content violating 'Islamic values'
13.article_body: Saudi Arabia and other countries of Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) have ordered Netflix to remove all content that violates "Islamic and societal values" in the region. GCC didn't name the content but said it included material directed at children. While discussing the issue, a state-run Saudi channel featured clips from an animated Netflix show that showed a same-sex relationship.

14.title: Mercedes-Benz to fire 3,600 employees in Brazil
14.article_body: Mercedes-Benz on Tuesday said it will fire 3,600 workers in Brazil under its plans of restructuring its truck and bus chassis plant in São Paulo. Further, the company said it plans to outsource logistics and maintenance services and production of certain components at the plant to cut costs. It added that it will give priority to local companies for outsourcing.

15.title: Vicky danced to my songs for 45 minutes on my b'day: Katrina Kaif
15.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif revealed that her husband Vicky Kaushal danced to her songs for 45 minutes on her birthday. "I was just recovering from being very unwell. I had a very tough time with COVID-19," she stated. "He could sense that I was not having a good time...He did a 45-minute concert of every single song of mine," Katrina added.

16.title: Believers in British policies are working to spread poison in country: Baghel
16.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Wednesday said that believers in British policies are spreading poison and attempting to divide the country. As Congress' Rahul Gandhi flagged off the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' yesterday, Baghel, while addressing a public meeting, said that Gandhi has launched the "padyatra" to once again spread the message of unity.

17.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman meets IMF MD to discuss regulation of crypto
17.article_body: In a meeting with International Monetary Fund (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urged IMF to play a lead role in crypto assets regulation. They discussed the need to have a globally coordinated, synchronised approach on the issue. India's upcoming G20 Presidency was also discussed with Georgieva calling India "a bright spot in the global economy".

18.title: Tiafoe becomes 1st American man to reach US Open semis since 2006
18.article_body: World number 26 Frances Tiafoe has become the first American man since 2006 to reach the semi-finals at the US Open. Tiafoe defeated world number 11 Andrey Rublev 7-6(7-3), 7-6(7-0), 6-4 in two-hour and 35 minutes on Wednesday night. "This is wild. This is crazy," said Tiafoe, who had defeated Rafael Nadal in the fourth round, in his on-court interview.

19.title: New rail overbridge on Delhi-Meerut Expressway to open by Sept 15: Officials
19.article_body: The under-construction rail overbridge (ROB) in Chipiyana, on Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME), is likely to open by September 15, National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) officials said. With the opening of ROB, the existing toll charges on DME's Phase 2 (from UP Gate to Dasna) will increase as the authority is presently charging only 75% of the proposed rates, officials added.

20.title: Musk can use whistleblower's claims but cannot delay Twitter trial: Judge
20.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk can use a whistleblower's allegations in his legal case but the trial over the $44 billion deal for Twitter cannot be delayed, ruled a judge. "I am convinced that even four weeks' delay would risk further harm to Twitter," wrote Chancellor Kathaleen McCormick of Delaware's Court of Chancery. The lawsuit goes to trial on October 17.

21.title: It was my truth: Siddhant Chaturvedi on his nepotism jibe at Ananya Panday
21.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, during his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', opened up about his statement regarding nepotism on Ananya Panday. "There was no intention to kind of harm anybody...I thought it was just my truth and I will always speak my truth because I mean yes, you know it's (the journey) been a bit difficult," he stated.

22.title: Daughter's plea to stay with mother accused in Sheena Bora case rejected
22.article_body: A Mumbai court on Wednesday rejected Vidhie Mukerjea's plea seeking permission to live with her mother Indrani Mukerjea, the prime accused in the Sheena Bora murder case, on her return to India. Vidhie has been living in London and is returning to India on September 10, as per her application. Indrani is currently out on bail in the case.

23.title: When I went in to bat I had the belief to hit the sixes: Naseem Shah
23.article_body: Talking about his two back-to-back sixes against Afghanistan in the final over, Pakistan's 19-year-old pacer Naseem Shah said he had the self-belief to hit the sixes to help his side win. "This will be a memorable game for me," he added. Pakistan required 11 off the final over to win with one wicket in hand when Naseem smashed the sixes.

24.title: Afghanistan fans break chairs, attack Pak fans at stadium after defeat; video goes viral
24.article_body: A video went viral showing Afghanistan fans breaking chairs and attacking Pakistani fans at the stadium in Sharjah after Pakistan defeated Afghanistan by one wicket in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 match on Wednesday. Earlier in the match, Pakistan's Asif Ali and Afghanistan's Fareed Ahmad Malik were involved in a fight, with Asif almost hitting Fareed with the bat.

25.title: Thanks for reminding: Shastri on Babar comparing Naseem's sixes to Miandad's six vs India
25.article_body: While being interviewed by Ravi Shastri, Pakistan captain Babar Azam compared Naseem Shah's two sixes in last over against Afghanistan to that of Javed Miandad's last-ball six against India in 1986 Austral-Asia Cup final. Shastri responded, "I was there...thanks for reminding." With Pakistan needing 11 runs to win off the last over, Naseem slammed two sixes on first two deliveries.

26.title: Man steals gold ring from Pune shop, buys smaller ring to mislead
26.article_body: A man stole a 12 gram gold ring worth ₹66,714 from a jewellery shop in Pune while pretending to be a customer. To throw off the lone saleswoman in the shop at the time, the man bought a 0.5 gram gold ring and left. The CCTV camera footage showed the man, who was not wearing a mask.

27.title: IndiGo Co-founder, Gangwal family to sell 2.8% stake for $250 mn
27.article_body: IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal, his family and their trust will sell a 2.8% stake in InterGlobe Aviation through a block deal for $250 million. As many as 10.8 million shares have been listed for sale at ₹1,850 apiece, a discount of 6.5% as against InterGlobe Aviation's closing price of ₹1,977.7 on the National Stock Exchange on Wednesday.

28.title: Multiple shootings reported in US' Memphis, 19-yr-old gunman goes live on Facebook
28.article_body: Multiple shootings have been reported in US' Memphis, with police saying that the 19-year-old gunman went live on Facebook. Ezekiel Kelly, who has been taken into custody, was arrested after crashing his car near Ivan Road and Hodge Road. There has been no word on a motive or if there were any injuries related to the shooting spree.

29.title: Maybe he wants to help BJP: Nitish Kumar on Prashant Kishor
29.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, while responding to a question about poll strategist Prashant Kishor, said, "Whatever statements he has been making...maybe he wants to stay with BJP. Maybe, he wants to help them." He called Kishor a "publicity expert". Kumar added, "Working with other political parties is his business...Does he know 'ABC' of what all has been done since 2005?"

30.title: We didn't control our nerves at the end: Nabi on last-over defeat vs Pakistan
30.article_body: Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi said they couldn't hold their nerves at the end during their Asia Cup Super 4 match against Pakistan. "The bowling and the fielding was brilliant, but we didn't finish well," he added. Pakistan needed 11 runs in the last over with one wicket remaining when Naseem Shah smashed two back-to-back sixes to help his side win.

31.title: Steve Jobs' daughter Eve posts meme to troll Apple after iPhone 14 launch
31.article_body: Apple Founder Steve Jobs' daughter Eve posted a meme to troll the company after the launch of iPhone 14. The meme shows a man posing with a shirt identical to the one he is wearing. "Me upgrading from iPhone 13 to iPhone 14 after Apple's announcement today," the meme posted by Eve read.

32.title: How much will iPhone 13 and iPhone 13 mini cost in India after today's price cut?
32.article_body: Apple's iPhone 13 will now cost ₹69,900 for the 128GB variant and ₹79,900 for 256GB after the company launched the 14 series lineup on Wednesday. The iPhone 13 mini now costs ₹64,900 and ₹74,900 for 128GB and 256GB, respectively. Meanwhile, iPhone 13 with 512GB storage will now cost ₹99,900 and iPhone 13 mini with 512 GB storage will cost ₹94,900.

33.title: How much will iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus, iPhone 14 Pro & iPhone 14 Pro Max cost in India?
33.article_body: Apple's 6.1-inch iPhone 14 will start from ₹79,900 and go up to ₹1,09,900. The 6.7-inch iPhone 14 Plus will start from ₹89,900 and go up to ₹1,19,900. The 6.1-inch iPhone 14 Pro starts from ₹1,29,900 and goes up to ₹1,79,900. The 6.7-inch display iPhone 14 Pro Max starts from ₹1,39,900 and goes up to ₹1,89,900.

34.title: Substantial size of users fake: Ex-Disney CEO on why they didn't buy Twitter in 2016
34.article_body: Speaking about why Disney didn't acquire Twitter in 2016, former CEO Bob Iger said that a "substantial amount, but not a majority" of Twitter users were fake accounts. He added, "I got cold feet for the right reasons...I thought we'd be taking on responsibility that we shouldn't take on." Meanwhile, reacting to his remarks, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Interesting."

35.title: Traffic movement to be restricted in Hyderabad on Sept 9-10 for Ganesh Visarjan
35.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police issued advisory ahead of Ganesh Visarjan on September 9 and September 10 imposing restrictions on several roads and areas of the city. As per the advisory, all heavy vehicles (including buses) from Sangareddy, Patancheru and BHEL proceeding to Kukatpally, Hyderabad City will not be allowed. Vehicles carrying Ganesh idols will not be allowed on Fathenagar flyover.

36.title: Germany's Scholz invites new UK PM to Berlin for inaugural visit
36.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and UK's newly elected Prime Minister Liz Truss held a phone conversation on Wednesday. Scholz invited Truss to Berlin for an inaugural visit. The two leaders discussed energy crisis, Russian invasion of Ukraine and the Northern Ireland Protocol. "The Prime Minister underlined the importance of ensuring democracy and freedom were upheld in Europe," UK government said.

37.title: Self-assessment is needed in B'wood about what we're making: Pankaj
37.article_body: Speaking about Bollywood films not working in recent times, actor Pankaj Tripathi has said that self-assessment is needed about what they are making. Opening up about the ongoing 'boycott Bollywood' trend on Twitter, Pankaj stated, "If a film is bad, it doesn't work and doesn't get boycotted. People don't go to the cinema halls. That's also a boycott...isn't it?"

38.title: Elected officials, police chiefs on US extremist group's leaked members list
38.article_body: The Anti-Defamation League Centre on Extremism analysed over 38,000 names on a leaked membership list of Oath Keepers, a far-right extremist group in US. The list included names of elected officials and police chiefs. More than 370 people are believed to be working with law enforcement agencies. More than 100 people are members of the military.

39.title: NEET-UG 2022 results declared; Rajasthan's Tanishka emerges topper
39.article_body: National Testing Agency has announced the medical entrance exam NEET-UG 2022 results. While 17,64,571 candidates appeared, 9,93,069 have passed. Maximum qualifying candidates are from Uttar Pradesh, followed by Maharashtra. Rajasthan's Tanishka has emerged as the topper of the entrance test, despite four candidates scoring equal marks. Vatsa Ashish Batra from Delhi has secured the second position.

40.title: Mumbai diagnostic lab staffer cheated of ₹49,500 via Google Pay
40.article_body: A 27-year-old woman working at a diagnostic centre in Mumbai was cheated of ₹49,500 by a man who said he wanted to get blood tests done for 25 people. The victim was instructed over a video call to open her Google Pay app and select the "Pay bills" option. A case has been registered by Mumbai Police.

41.title: Leopard spotted on campus of defence institute in Pune
41.article_body: A leopard was sighted on the campus of Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DIAT) in Pune on Tuesday night. According to DIAT officials, security personnel saw the leopard on a tree after they were alerted by the barking of dogs. "Security guards also recorded a video of the leopard getting down from the tree," said an officer.

42.title: IMD issues yellow alert for Pune till September 11
42.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a 'yellow' alert for the Pune district till September 11, warning of heavy rain, thunder, lightning and gusty winds. Notably, Pune's Shivajinagar recorded 42.8 mm of rainfall from 8.30 am to 11.30 pm on Wednesday. IMD has also issued a 'yellow' alert for Palghar, Thane, Mumbai, Nashik and other districts till Sunday.

43.title: Pharma company GSK fires employee after viral video of his abusive rant on flight
43.article_body: Pharmaceutical and biotech company GlaxoSmithKline fired one of its employees after he was caught on camera yelling homophobic and racist slurs on a Philadelphia-Dallas flight. The chemical engineer was seen shouting profanities at fellow passengers while being removed from the flight. Before getting off the plane, he also declared that he is a chemical engineer who works for GlaxoSmithKline.

44.title: 30-yr-old wanted for stabbing 10 people to death in Canada dies soon after arrest
44.article_body: The suspect sought by Canadian authorities in a stabbing incident that killed 10 people was arrested on Wednesday but suffered unspecified "medical distress" and died a short time later at a hospital. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police added that Myles Sanderson, 30, was arrested near the town of Rosthern, Saskatchewan. Earlier, Myles' brother, also a suspect, was found dead.

45.title: BESCOM blames ad firm for woman's electrocution in Bengaluru
45.article_body: Two days after a 22-year-old woman died of electrocution on a waterlogged road, Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) told the police that it was not responsible for the incident. "They have put the blame on an advertisement agency saying it was the wiring from the billboard attached to the electric post that led to the electrocution," the police said.

46.title: Harbhajan Singh helps in rescuing 21-year-old Punjab girl held captive in Oman
46.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Harbhajan Singh helped in rescuing 21-year-old Punjab girl named Kamaljeet Kaur, who was "illegally held" in Oman. The ex-cricketer collaborated with Indian Embassy in Oman for her rescue. Kamaljeet had approached a local agent in Punjab, who promised her job of cook for an Indian family in Oman. However, when she reached Oman, she was held captive.

47.title: Rahul Gandhi to sleep in container for 150 days of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
47.article_body: During the 150-day 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress' Rahul Gandhi will stay and sleep in a container. As per ANI, Congress has denied that Rahul will put up in hotels during the nationwide 'yatra'. Instead, containers have been prepared to accommodate the Congress MP and other party leaders who will accompany him on the yatra.

48.title: 3 men trimming tree electrocuted as iron trolley touches wire in Delhi
48.article_body: At least three men were electrocuted after an iron trolley that they were using to trim leaves of trees at a farmhouse, used for hosting wedding functions, in Delhi's Bawana came in contact with a live wire, police said. While two of the victims were trimming the tree leaves using the trolley, the third victim had come to their rescue.

49.title: Scolded for coming late, Class 10 boy hits school guard with rod in Delhi
49.article_body: A Class 10 student allegedly attacked a guard of his school with an iron rod in Delhi's Tilak Nagar on Wednesday after being scolded for coming late to school. The 32-year-old guard, Vijay Kumar, sustained minor injury and was hospitalised. The 16-year-old boy had got into an argument with Kumar two days ago for coming late to school, police said.

50.title: Apple to release iOS 16 with redesigned lock screen on September 12
50.article_body: Apple has announced that it will be releasing its latest operating system iOS 16 on September 12. iOS 16 will allow users to add widgets to the lock screen, use the Live Text feature to pull text from videos and photos and edit and recall messages sent on iMessage. It'll also offer passkeys as an easier and safer sign-in method.

51.title: Pakistan's Asif Ali fights with Afghan bowler, almost hits him with bat; video viral
51.article_body: Pakistan's Asif Ali pushed Afghanistan fast bowler Fareed Ahmad Malik after the latter dismissed him in their Asia Cup 2022 match on Wednesday. A video has gone viral showing Fareed giving Asif a send-off after which Asif pushes him and almost hits him with his bat. Other Afghanistan players and the umpire intervened and separated Asif and Fareed.

52.title: Apple unveils iPhone 14 Pro, iPhone 14 Pro Max starting from $999 & $1,099
52.article_body: Apple unveiled iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max smartphones starting from $999 and $1,099 respectively. The phones come with 6.1-inch and 6.7-inch screens with always-on display and have a new pill-shaped cut-out called the 'Dynamic Island'. The phones also feature a 48MP main camera. They will come in four different colours.

53.title: Apple unveils iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus starting from $799 and $899
53.article_body: Apple unveiled the iPhone 14 with a 6.1-inch display and iPhone 14 Plus with a 6.7-inch display starting from $799 and $899, respectively. They come with a familiar notch at the top and a new 12MP main camera and new front camera with auto-focus. The iPhone 14 also has new sensors that can detect a car crash.

54.title: Apple unveils 2nd generation AirPods Pro with 6-hour listening time costing $249
54.article_body: Apple on Wednesday unveiled the second generation AirPods Pro costing $249, marking the first update for the Pro model since the initial launch in 2019. The new AirPods Pro can cancel twice as much noise and allow six hours of listening on a single charge. It comes with swipe controls on the stems and a speaker in its charging case.

55.title: Apple unveils second-generation Apple Watch SE starting from $249
55.article_body: Apple has unveiled the second-generation Apple Watch SE model starting from $249. The Apple Watch SE, with a 30% larger display than the Series 3, will have fall detection, crash detection, family setup and activity tracking along with Emergency SOS. It'll feature the S8 chip and will cost $249 for the GPS model and $299 for the cellular model.

56.title: Apple unveils Apple Watch Ultra for extreme sports costing $799
56.article_body: Apple has unveiled Apple Watch Ultra with a 49 mm titanium case and a customisable action button, which will cost $799. It has been specifically designed for intense sports tracking. The Apple Watch Ultra is WR-100 water resistant and it has an automatic built-in depth gauge. It's also EN13319 certified, which means it can be used as a dive computer.

57.title: At least $1 billion required to avert famine in Somalia: UN
57.article_body: At least $1 billion is urgently needed to avert a famine in Somalia, the United Nations (UN) said. The warning comes as two more dry seasons are predicted for the country. UN official Martin Griffiths said this new funding requirement is separate from the UN's recent appeal of about $1.4 billion in emergency aid to the country.

58.title: Pandemic increased waitlist by 3-fold at AIIMS' corneal transplant centre: Chief doctor
58.article_body: The number of patients waiting for corneal transplant at Dr RP Centre for Ophthalmic Sciences, AIIMS, has increased by three-fold due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the centre's chief Dr JS Titiyal said. The National Eye Bank at the institute saw 88 per cent utilisation rate of corneas in 2021, which was higher than the national average of 67 per cent.

59.title: Govt to tighten rules over fake, paid reviews on social media
59.article_body: The Indian government has decided to tighten rules regarding fake and/or paid reviews on e-commerce websites and social media. Rohit Kumar Singh from India's consumer affairs department said that the government will soon announce a framework of regulations targeting people who are paid for endorsements. He added that those endorsing will be held liable in issues related to the product.

60.title: Nearly 380 killed in tribal clashes in Sudan this year: UN
60.article_body: The United Nations (UN) has said nearly 380 people have been killed in tribal clashes in Sudan from January to August this year. Over 430 people were injured in the same period, which saw 224 violent incidents in 12 of the 18 provinces of the country. Most of the violence was reported from conflict-hit Darfur region.

61.title: 2 die after car runs over labourers sleeping on footpath in UP
61.article_body: Two labourers died and one was injured after a speeding SUV ran over labourers who were asleep on a footpath in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur, the police said. All four people travelling in the car were arrested by the police. They added that the SUV lost control and hit the railing of the Gorakhnath overbridge, before running over the sleeping labourers.

62.title: India crash out of Asia Cup 2022 final race as Pakistan defeat Afghanistan in last over
62.article_body: India have crashed out of the Asia Cup 2022 final race after Pakistan defeated Afghanistan in the last over in their Super 4 stage match on Wednesday. Afghanistan are also officially out of the final race. The final will now be played between Pakistan and Sri Lanka on Sunday. India and Afghanistan will face each other in dead-rubber encounter tomorrow.

63.title: Apple unveils Watch Series 8 with car crash detection starting from $399
63.article_body: Apple has unveiled the Apple Watch Series 8 starting from $399. The new model is capable of detecting a car crash and notifying emergency services and emergency contacts. The Series 8 features an always-on display with narrow edges, and is crack-resistant and swim-proof. The Watch Series 8 comes with temperature sensors and new cycle tracking feature to help track ovulation.

64.title: SC's Justice Chandrachud-led Constitution bench to go paperless
64.article_body: The Supreme Court's Constitution bench has decided to go completely paperless while hearing the Centre and the Delhi government dispute over administrative control. The five-judge bench led by Justice DY Chandrachud also said that the Information Technology cell of the court agreed to train seniors on the use of technology. The court has also allowed the proceedings to be recorded.

65.title: Some chimpanzees are rock drummers, some jazz: Study
65.article_body: A new study has found that chimpanzees use their feet and hands to drum out messages to one another on tree roots. Moreover, they also have their signature styles of drumming that resemble rock or jazz rhythms. The study revealed this skill helps them to spread information over long distances, indicating their location and what they are doing.

66.title: NIA announces ₹10 lakh bounty on fugitive terrorist Harpreet Singh
66.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Wednesday announced a cash reward of ₹10 lakh for any information leading to the arrest of fugitive terrorist Harpreet Singh alias 'Happy Malaysia', who is accused in the 2021 Ludhiana court complex blast. He's currently is Malaysia, the NIA said. It added that he's associated with International Sikh Youth Federation, which planned the blast.

67.title: 21L farmers found ineligible for farm support scheme: UP Minister
67.article_body: Of the 2.85 crore farmers selected under the Centre's Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi scheme in Uttar Pradesh, 21 lakh have been found ineligible, said state Agriculture Minister Surya Pratap Shahi on Wednesday. The money transferred to the ineligible beneficiaries will be recovered, Shahi said. Under the scheme, ₹6,000 income support is given to all land-holding farmer families annually.

68.title: Govt extends ceasefire agreement with Naga insurgent group for a year
68.article_body: The central government has extended the ceasefire agreement with National Socialist Council of Nagaland (K) Niki group, a break-away faction of the Nagaland insurgent group NSCN, by another year. The decision was announced by the Union Home Ministry on Wednesday. NSCN (K) Niki is led by Niki Sumi, who is accused of killing 18 Indian soldiers in Manipur in 2015.

69.title: Lucknow's Levana Suites sealed after fire killed 4 people
69.article_body: The Lucknow Development Authority on Wednesday sealed the Levana Suites hotel where a fire accident killed four people on Monday. The authority is said to have found several building norm violations and has recommended action against responsible persons. The police on Tuesday had arrested hotel owners Rahul and Rohit Agarwal and General Manager Sagar Srivastava.

70.title: US, India will work for free and open Indo-Pacific: White House
70.article_body: The US will partner with India to advance a free and open Indo-Pacific, the White House has said. Press Secretary Karin Jean-Pierre said India and the US are partners in important areas, including climate, defence, vaccines and technology. The comments come as China is engaged in several territorial disputes in the South China Sea (SCS) and the East China Sea.

71.title: No such thing: Alia on unfavourable environment for Bollywood
71.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she doesn't think there is a negative environment against Bollywood. "There is no such thing. It is a beautiful environment to release a movie. Right now, we need to be healthy, happy, safe and secure. We should all feel grateful for just life in general," she said at a press conference. Alia concluded, "Everything is positive."

72.title: Won't be part of TKSS, wanted to take break: Chandan
72.article_body: Chandan Prabhakar of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS) has confirmed that he is not returning to the show's new season. Chandan clarified that there is no specific reason for not coming back and he "just wanted to take a break". Earlier, Krushna Abhishek had shared that he won't be a part of Kapil Sharma's show because of "agreement issues".

73.title: Medha Patkar is urban naxal, AAP projecting her as Guj CM face: Paatil
73.article_body: BJP leader CR Paatil on Wednesday termed Narmada Bachao Andolan activist Medha Patkar an "urban naxal" and "staunch anti-Gujarat person", claiming that AAP is projecting her as a CM candidate in upcoming state Assembly elections. AAP, however, has refuted Paatil's claim. Notably, Patkar had contested the 2014 Lok Sabha polls from Mumbai North East as an AAP candidate.

74.title: Count this as 1156th day of the reign of Babar: Rizwan after becoming no. 1 T20I batter
74.article_body: After displacing his compatriot Babar Azam as the world number one T20I batter, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan tweeted, "Count this as 1156th day of the reign of Kaptaan @babarazam258." He added, "Kaptaan or me alag nahi hain...King remains the King. Hum sab aik hain." Babar has been at top of the T20I batting rankings for 1,155 days in his career.

75.title: Nick Kyrgios smashes and breaks 2 racquets after crashing out of US Open, video viral
75.article_body: World number 25 Nick Kyrgios smashed and broke two racquets after crashing out of the US Open 2022 in the quarter-finals. Kyrgios lost the quarter-final to Russia's Karen Khachanov 5-7, 6-4, 5-7, 7-6(7-3), 4-6. Kyrgios was also seen throwing a drinks bottle on the court during the match. After the match, Kyrgios stated that he was "devastated".

76.title: Felt bad that Ranbir-Alia couldn't visit Mahakaleshwar temple: Ayan
76.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji said he "felt very bad" that Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt couldn't seek blessings at Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga temple, Ujjain. Ayan said the couple was "very keen" to visit. However, when they heard of the protest against Ranbir for his past comments on eating beef, Ayan said he decided he should go alone and seek blessings for everybody.

77.title: India's health sector to become $50 bn industry by 2025: Minister
77.article_body: Union Minister of State for Science and Technology Dr Jitendra Singh on Wednesday said that India's healthcare sector is expected to grow to reach the size of $50 billion by the year 2025. About 80% of the healthcare system aims to increase investment in digital healthcare tools in the coming five years, he said.

78.title: BJP, RSS think Tricolour is their personal property: Rahul Gandhi
78.article_body: While addressing the public during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' campaign in Kanniyakumari on Wednesday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the Indian national flag is under attack by the BJP and the RSS. "They think that this flag is their personal property," he added. He stated that the flag was not earned by one person but by every single Indian.

79.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is India's second freedom struggle: Chidambaram
79.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is the country's second freedom struggle and it'll go on till divisive forces are defeated. "I wish to tell those criticising...'Bharat Jodo Yatra' that you had no role in India's freedom struggle during which Mahatma Gandhi gave the slogan: do or die," Chidambaram said. "Now too, you'll have no role," he added.

80.title: JNU students claim admin imposing fines up to ₹15,000 over protests
80.article_body: Accusing the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) administration of "harassment", a section of students have claimed that fines of up to ₹15,000 are being imposed on them for participating in protests. The students also said that they have been "banned" from registering for the next semester. The JNU Chief Proctor, Rajnish Kumar Mishra, has, however, denied these allegations.

81.title: SC allows Alt News Co-founder to move Delhi HC against FIR in UP
81.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair to approach the Delhi High Court for quashing an FIR against him in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur. The FIR was lodged by the Rashtriya Hindu Sher Sena's Sitapur district head Bhagwan Sharan. He alleged that a tweet by Zubair hurt his religious sentiments.

82.title: 'Chup' looks at how adverse reviews impact films: R Balki
82.article_body: Director R Balki said he got the idea of 'Chup' after his film 'Cheeni Kum' failed to impress the critics. "My film looks at how adverse reviews impact a film," he said. Balki said he likes to surprise himself and his audience by doing "something completely unexpected".  'Chup' stars Sunny Deol, Dulquer Salmaan and Shreya Dhanwanthary in the lead roles.

83.title: Leader can be decided later: Nitish on Oppn alliance after meeting Pawar
83.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met Nationalist Congress Party supremo Sharad Pawar on Wednesday to discuss the formation of an opposition alliance to take on the BJP in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "The alliance's [leader] can be decided later. It's important to come together first," Kumar said. Notably, Kumar recently refuted speculations about desiring to become the next PM.

84.title: Brad Pitt sued by Angelina Jolie's former company for $250 mn over French winery dispute
84.article_body: A company founded by Angelina Jolie filed a case against Brad Pitt for $250 million. It's over the couple's French winery that they bought together. In July, a judge said Brad and his partners must turn over documents to Angelina's team, making her win the case. The new lawsuit claims Brad launched campaign to "seize control" of the winery.

85.title: NASA to repair leak at Artemis-1 moon rocket on launch pad itself
85.article_body: NASA will replace the faulty seal that caused a hydrogen leak in a "quick disconnect" interface between the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and the liquid hydrogen fuel feed line at the launch pad itself. The launch vehicle will then be moved back into the Vehicle Assembly Building (VAB). NASA's Artemis 1 Moon mission was postponed due to hydrogen leak.

86.title: Ease of doing business in India appeals to Adobe: CEO Narayen
86.article_body: The ease of doing business in India and digitisation appeal to Adobe, the company's CEO Shantanu Narayen said. "We have been expanding dramatically in India," Narayen said. "[To] hear about the ambitious idea of how the GDP gonna evolve, how the PLI schemes and what's happening with commerce and what's happening with transactions, it's inspiring," he added.

87.title: UK PM Liz Truss' Cabinet is Britain's first without white man in 4 most senior posts
87.article_body: UK PM Liz Truss' Cabinet marks the first time a white man doesn't hold any of the country's four most important ministerial positions. Truss appointed Kwasi Kwarteng as Britain's first Black finance minister, while James Cleverly is the country's first Black foreign minister. Meanwhile, Suella Braverman has been appointed interior minister and Therese Coffey has been appointed health minister.

88.title: Immense scope to cooperate with Russia in field of energy: PM Modi
88.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said on Wednesday that India is keen to strengthen its partnership with Russia on Arctic subjects. He added that there is immense potential for both countries to cooperate in the field of energy. PM Modi's remarks came during an online plenary session address at the Eastern Economic Forum, which is being held in Russia's Vladivostok.

89.title: $258-bn lawsuit accusing Musk of driving Dogecoin's prices up expands
89.article_body: The $258-billion racketeering lawsuit accusing billionaire Elon Musk of intentionally driving up prices of Dogecoin over 36,000% over two years and then letting it crash has expanded. The lawsuit has now added seven investor plaintiffs and six defendants. According to an amended complaint filed on Tuesday, Musk's Tesla, SpaceX and Boring Co, among others were part of the racketeering attempt.

90.title: K'taka BJP's 'Janotsava' rally postponed due to demise of Umesh Katti
90.article_body: Karnataka BJP's 'Janotsava' rally, scheduled to be held at Doddaballapura on Thursday, has been postponed to September 11 due to the demise of minister Umesh Katti. This is the third such postponement of the event. The event is set to mark the completion of three years of BJP's rule in Karnataka and the Basavaraj Bommai-led government's one year in office.

91.title: Orange Health announces ESOP, equity buyback worth $1 mn
91.article_body: Accel-backed diagnostic firm Orange Health has announced its maiden Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP) and equity buyback programme worth $1 million. 25 existing and former employees are eligible to participate in the ESOP buyback and liquidate their stock options, the company said in a statement. The Bengaluru-based startup was founded in 2020 by Dhruv Gupta and Tarun Bhambra.

92.title: 2 elderly farmers electrocuted to death in MP's Gwalior
92.article_body: Two elderly farmers were electrocuted after they accidentally came in contact with a power transformer while working in their agricultural field in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior on Wednesday, police said. The deceased were identified as 60-year-old Chandan Singh Kushwaha and 65-year-old Mayaram Patsaria. People working nearby took them to a hospital, where they were declared dead, police added.

93.title: Putin, Xi to meet in Uzbekistan next week
93.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping are set to meet in Uzbekistan next week, an official said on Wednesday. The meeting will take place at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Samarkand, said Russian Ambassador to China Andrei Denisov. Xi and Putin last met in Beijing in February, few weeks before Moscow ordered the invasion of Ukraine.

94.title: US oil price falls below $85 mark for first time since Jan over demand fears
94.article_body: US oil price fell below the $85 mark for the first time since January 2022 as a dollar surge and global demand concerns pulled down prices despite Russia's threat to disrupt supplies. As of 8:30 pm, US West Texas Intermediate had fallen $3.21 to $83.67/barrel while Brent crude had fallen $3.08 to $89.75/barrel. Both indices had fallen over 3.5%.

95.title: Fisherman suffers gunshot injury near Navy's gunnery school in Kerala
95.article_body: A 60-year-old fisherman suffered a gunshot injury in the ear when he was coming to shore on his boat near INS Dronacharya, a gunnery school of the Indian Navy, in Kerala's Kochi. The Navy said the bullet was not manufactured by it. As per a police official, the injury was minor and the bullet was found inside the boat.

96.title: Will introduce framework to regulate social media: Govt tells HC
96.article_body: The Centre told the Delhi High Court that it will introduce a framework to regulate social media platforms at "some point in time". Since the framework will be prospective, the Centre said that suspension of social media accounts will be looked at under the existing regulations. The HC granted the Centre further time to apprise it of new developments.

97.title: Man arrested from Rajasthan for giving death threat to Sidhu Moosewala's father
97.article_body: A man has been arrested from Rajasthan's Jodhpur for allegedly sending a death threat to late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh Sidhu. In a police complaint, Balkaur Singh stated that he got a mail wherein a threat was made to his life and money was demanded from him. Punjab Police has got a five-day custody of the accused.

98.title: Govt asks Amazon to stop selling devices that can disable car seat belt alarms
98.article_body: Government has asked Amazon to stop selling devices designed to disable car seat belt alarms, Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said. Gadkari stated metal clips are inserted in seat belt slots to bypass alarm that keeps pinging when belts aren't in use while a car is being driven. This comes after the recent demise of Cyrus Mistry in a car crash.

99.title: Can put PM's pic on gas cylinders: MLC amid Modi pic row in Telangana
99.article_body: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman questioned the absence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's picture from a ration shop in Telangana, MLC K Kavitha said that past Prime Ministers' pictures weren't displayed outside ration shops. "If you want [PM's] pictures to be put up, we'll...do so [wherever the costs are rising]...We'll put them up on gas cylinders…[and at] petrol...stations," she added.

100.title: Bank of Maharashtra raises ₹710 cr from bonds for business growth
100.article_body: State-owned Bank of Maharashtra (BoM) on Wednesday said that it has raised ₹710 crore from bonds to fund business growth. According to BoM, the capital was raised via Basel III compliant Additional Tier 1 bonds of ₹710 crore at a coupon rate of 8.74%. The issue reportedly garnered overwhelming response from investors as the issue was subscribed by 10 times.

101.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' landmark occasion for Congress: Sonia Gandhi
101.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a landmark occasion for the party. Stating that the party would be rejuvenated through this rally, she also expressed regret at her inability to join in person owing to medical checkups and added that she would participate in spirit. Gandhi described the occasion as a "transformational moment in Indian politics".

102.title: Bengaluru hotel room rates jump to ₹40,000 per night amid floods
102.article_body: Hotel room rates in Bengaluru have doubled to ₹30,000-₹40,000 per night amid floods in the city. This comes after several residents, whose houses have been inundated, started moving into the hotels. As per reports, many of the hotels at Old Airport Road, Whitefield, Outer Ring Road and Koramangala are fully booked till Friday.

103.title: Earliest known mammal that lived 225 mn years ago identified by its teeth
103.article_body: Using fossil dental records, scientists have identified the earliest known mammal that lived 225 million years ago. A shrew-like creature, Brasilodon quadrangularis, grew up to 20 centimetres in length and existed at the same time as some of the oldest dinosaurs. The extinct vertebrate was found to have two successive sets of teeth - baby (milk) teeth and permanent teeth.

104.title: Musk can use whistleblower claims but Twitter trial won't be delayed: Chancellor
104.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's request to add whistleblower claims to his Twitter countersuit was accepted by Chancellor Kathaleen McCormick on Wednesday. However, Musk's request to delay the trial over his bid to walk away from the $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter was rejected. "I'm convinced that even four weeks' delay would risk further harm to Twitter," McCormick said.

105.title: 'India's biggest car thief', who stole over 5,000 cars, had ₹10-crore villa and 3 wives
105.article_body: Anil Chauhan, dubbed 'India's biggest car thief' by police, owned a ₹10-crore villa and had three wives and seven children. Chauhan stole over 5,000 cars in 24 years and he is involved in over 181 cases. Police said that two of his wives claimed they didn't know about Chauhan's criminal activities and thought he was a car dealer.

106.title: Instead of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Rahul should do 'Cong Jodo Yatra': Athawale
106.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Wednesday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and said he should do a 'Congress Jodo Yatra' instead of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "PM Narendra Modi is working to connect the country," Athawale said. "Congress party is taking out a rally to create controversy in the country, that's why his Yatra is...'Bharat Todo Yatra'," Athawale added.

107.title: Cipla shares hit 52-week high as it gets USFDA nod for cancer drug
107.article_body: Cipla has announced that it received the final approval from the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) to launch the generic version of a rare blood cancer medicine. USFDA has approved its Abbreviated New Drug Application for Lenalidomide capsule. Following the announcement, Cipla's stock rose about 2% to ₹1,062, which's close to its 52-week high of ₹1,083 hit in March.

108.title: 4 killed, 3 injured as bus rams into two bikes in Rajasthan's Ajmer
108.article_body: Four people, including an infant, were killed and three others were injured after a bus rammed into two motorcycles in Rajasthan's Ajmer, police said on Wednesday. The deceased were identified as four-month-old Khushi, 28-year-old Laxmi Gurjar, 25-year-old Laxman Gurjar and 26-year-old Ganesh Bhil, police said. The injured were admitted to government hospital in Ajmer for treatment, the SHO said.

109.title: 3 drug suppliers held in Goa, will severely affect drug trade: CM
109.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said police have arrested three main drug suppliers which will severely affect the illegal drug trade in the state. "The government wants to give a strict message to tourists that our state is not for...drugs and its trade and consumption will not be entertained," Sawant said, adding nightclubs are also under police's radar.

110.title: Himachal top performer among neighbours in solving kidnapping cases: Police
110.article_body: Himachal Pradesh has become the top-performing state among its neighbours in tracing kidnapped and missing persons, state police claimed, quoting National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data. Police stated that 451 of 528 kidnapped persons were traced in 2021, recording a recovery rate of 85.4%. Himachal Pradesh stood second among states in finding kidnapped persons after Odisha, police added.

111.title: K'taka will seek aid from central govt for flood-hit areas: CM
111.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the state government will seek compensation from the Centre for damages caused due to rains. He held a meeting with the inter-ministerial central team assessing the extent of damages caused due to floods. "The team was asked to take stock of the flood situation in Bengaluru, Mandya and Ramanagar," a statement by CM's office said.

112.title: Centre to soon issue guidelines for social media influencers: Report
112.article_body: The Centre will soon issue guidelines for social media influencers mandating them to disclose paid promotions, ET Now reported. The Consumer Affairs Ministry is likely to issue a standard operating procedure in next 10 days. The guidelines will reportedly include a financial penalty of ₹10 lakh for first offence, ₹20 lakh for second offence and ₹50 lakh for continuous violations.

113.title: KRK gets bail week after arrest over derogatory tweets on Akshay Kumar
113.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan, popularly known as KRK, was granted bail by a magistrate court in Mumbai's Borivali in the 2020 derogatory tweets case. He was arrested last week over his tweets on actor Akshay Kumar and filmmaker Ram Gopal Verma. Khan is likely to be released from the Thane jail on Thursday, his lawyer said.

114.title: Alia probably had the best year in the history of actors: Ranbir
114.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said Alia Bhatt has "probably had the best year any artist has ever had, in the history of actors" with 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', 'RRR', 'Darlings' and now, 'Brahmastra'. Ranbir said while he loved 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', he became Alia's "huge admirer" after 'Highway'. He said 'Highway' gave birth to an actor that "Indian cinema and world cinema weren't ready for".

115.title: Centre accords Z+ security cover to former President Ram Nath Kovind
115.article_body: Centre has accorded 'Z plus' category security cover of a central paramilitary force to ex-President Ram Nath Kovind, officials have confirmed. He will be granted the armed escort on an all-India basis and the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) VIP security commando unit will render the task, officials said. Kovind's residence located on Delhi's Janpath Road will also be secured.

116.title: Inflation has eased to manageable level: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
116.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday said inflation has eased to a manageable level in India in the past few months. "Some...are red-lettered (priorities), some may not be. Red-lettered ones would...be jobs, equitable wealth distribution," she said. "In that sense, inflation is not red-lettered," she added. As per data, retail inflation softened to 6.71% in July in India.

117.title: Labour groups, investors ask Apple to review how it treats workers' rights
117.article_body: Labour groups and unions have filed a shareholder proposal asking Apple to review how it treats workers' rights. The proposal, filed by a group including SOC Investment Group, accuses Apple of an "apparent misalignment" between its public commitments to issues like freedom of association and accusations that it has tried to unfairly deter union organising.

118.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh shares pics of horse gifted to him by Mongolian President
118.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh took to Twitter to share pictures of horse gifted to him by Mongolian President Ukhnaagiin Khurelsukh during his visit to Mongolia. "A special gift from our special friends in Mongolia. I've named this magnificent beauty, 'Tejas'. Thank you...President  Khurelsukh. Thank you Mongolia," he tweeted. Rajnath Singh is the first Indian Defence Minister to visit Mongolia.

119.title: Kashmiri MBBS student dies in B'desh; Omar asks MEA to repatriate body
119.article_body: A female MBBS student from J&K's Anantnag who was pursuing her MBBS degree in Bangladesh died there on Wednesday after a mishap. The victim, Khusboo Manzur, reportedly fell from her college's hostel building on Tuesday and succumbed to her injuries a day later. Former J&K CMs Omar Abdullah and Mehbooba Mufti have sought the MEA's help in repatriating her body.

120.title: Still the boy who cherishes time with you: Dulquer on Mammootty
120.article_body: On Mammootty's birthday, actor Dulquer Salmaan recalled how, as a child, he used to make the most of his time with his father. He said that even now, when he's home with Mammootty, time stands still for him and he becomes the boy "cherishing the time he gets when his father has a day off from work". Mammootty turned 71.

121.title: Nitish Kumar meets Sharad Pawar, says 'we are keen to unite Opp'n'
121.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, who's in Delhi to unify the Opposition ahead of the 2024 general elections, met NCP President Sharad Pawar on Wednesday. After the meeting, Kumar said, "Pawar and I are keen to unite Opposition forces who're not with the BJP." He added, "A leader of the alliance can be decided later. It's important to come together first."

122.title: 23 killed, dozens injured in karaoke bar fire in Vietnam
122.article_body: At least 23 people were killed and dozens were injured in a fire accident at a karaoke bar in south Vietnam on Tuesday night, officials said on Wednesday. The fire spread quickly as the bar had foam soundproofing and wooden panels installed, witnesses said. Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has ordered a probe into the cause of fire.

123.title: Was planning to do an album with Bamba Bakya: AR Rahman
123.article_body: Composer-singer AR Rahman remembered late playback singer Bamba Bakya at the trailer launch of Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One'. "I was planning to do an album with Bamba Bakya. Unfortunately, he left before that. I hope he's happy wherever he is," Rahman said. Bakya, who reportedly passed away due to cardiac arrest, sang 'Ponni Nadhi' for Mani Ratnam's film.

124.title: Arunachal Pradesh Assembly passes civil courts amendment bill
124.article_body: The Arunachal Pradesh Assembly on Wednesday passed a civil courts amendment bill which seeks to transfer suits pending in the courts of deputy commissioners to junior and senior division civil judges. CM Pema Khandu moved The Arunachal Pradesh Civil Courts (Amendment) Bill, 2022. The statement of the bill says the objective is to lessen the workload of regular courts.

125.title: Imagined Sridevi as Kundavai in 'Ponniyin...': Rajinikanth
125.article_body: At the trailer launch of 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One', Tamil actor Rajinikanth said he imagined late actor Sridevi in the role of Kundavai. In the Mani Ratnam directorial, Trisha plays the role of Kundavai. "When I read the story, I imagined Kamal as Arulmozhivarman, Sridevi as Kundavai, Vijaykanth as Aditya Karikalan and Sathyaraj as Pazhuvettaraiyar," he said.

126.title: It's not final report: MP CM on 'irregularities' worth over ₹100 cr in ration scheme
126.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday reacted to a report by the state's Accountant General on alleged irregularities worth over ₹100 crore in the 'Poshan-Aahar' or supplementary nutrition scheme. He said this is not the final report of the Accountant General. "This is a preliminary report...the department is yet to present its side," he added.

127.title: Over 1 lakh Brahmāstra tickets sold, biggest advance for Hindi film post pandemic: Report
127.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's 'Brahmāstra' has sold over one lakh tickets in advance booking, as per reports. The film reportedly has the highest advance bookings for a Hindi original, since the COVID-19 pandemic. It has already exceeded the advance booking collection of Kartik Aaryan's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', reports added.

128.title: Seat-belts are important, so is fixing potholes: Pooja Bhatt
128.article_body: Pooja Bhatt said fixing potholes and damaged roads is as important as wearing seat-belts. "When will the usage of substandard material to build our roads, highways, freeways be deemed criminal?" she asked in a tweet. She said "maintaining those roads once built & inaugurated with pomp is key". The tweet came days after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's death.

129.title: Russia continues shelling areas near nuclear power plant: Ukraine
129.article_body: Russia has shelled areas near Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine, a Ukrainian official said on Wednesday. The reports of shelling come as experts from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) inspected the plant over the weekend. Later, the IAEA said it is "still gravely concerned about the situation" but there was no indication of a "proliferation concern."

130.title: Video of man helping dog on flooded B'luru road goes viral
130.article_body: A video on social media wherein a man is helping a dog wade through a flooded road in Bengaluru has gone viral. The video, which has received over 11,000 views, was posted by actor and former Lok Sabha member Divya Spandana on her Twitter account. A user commented "let small ray of hope widen further", while another wrote "good job".

131.title: India, US combined GDP expected to be $70 trillion by 2050: Adani
131.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has said the combined value of India and the United States Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is expected to be $70 trillion by 2050. "It will make up 35-40% of the global economy," he stated. "The existing $150 billion bilateral trade between India and...US is no more than a speck in the ocean," he said further.

132.title: Man gets only salan on ordering 'inter-city' biryani in Gurugram, shares pic
132.article_body: A Gurugram-based man said he placed an order for biryani using Zomato's new inter-city food delivery service. However, he was only delivered a portion of salan. "It's a double loss for me. As...customer and as...shareholder," he tweeted. The man later said Zomato officials managed to track his order and also sent him extra biryani.

133.title: Goyal launches SETU, aims to connect Indian startups to US investors
133.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce, Piyush Goyal, launched Supporting Entrepreneurs for Transformation and Upskilling (SETU), which is an initiative aimed at connecting Indian startups with US investors. Citing lack of mentorship as a reason why some startups fail, he urged US entrepreneurs to participate. Encouraging investments in India, Goyal also highlighted the huge market potential of the country.

134.title: MP man denied bowls & spoons at samosa shop calls CM helpline
134.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur recently called the CM helpline number to complain about an eatery denying him bowls and spoons. "There's a shop named Rakesh Samosa at Chhatarpur bus stand...person who gets...samosa packed here is not given a spoon or...bowl. Please get the problem resolved ASAP," his complaint stated. The helpline, however, disposed of his complaint.

135.title: Robber sprays black paint on CCTV before blowing up ATM & looting ₹11 lakh in Maha
135.article_body: A robber sprayed black paint on a CCTV camera at an ATM before blowing up the machine and looting ₹11 lakh in Maharashtra's Satara on Wednesday. The accused used explosive materials such as gelatin for the blast. A video of the incident shows the man covering his face with his hand while spraying the paint on the CCTV camera.

136.title: Solar Orbiter hit by mass ejection from Sun during Venus flyby
136.article_body: On September 4, the European Space Agency's (ESA) Solar Orbiter was approaching Venus for a flyby when it was hit by a coronal mass ejection, the space agency said. "Fortunately...there were no negative effects on the spacecraft as ESA-NASA solar observatory is designed to withstand and in fact measure violent outbursts from our star," ESA said.

137.title: Flight ops at B'luru airport have returned to normalcy: Official
137.article_body: Flight operations at Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru, which were affected following heavy rains over the weekend, have returned to complete normalcy, a spokesperson said. On Monday from 1 am to 3 am, six flights at the Bengaluru airport were diverted to Chennai and nine services were delayed. The spokesperson said since then all flights have been maintaining schedule.

138.title: Traffic movement to be restricted in Mumbai on Sept 9 for Ganesh Visarjan
138.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police has imposed traffic restrictions on September 9 in view of Ganesh Visarjan. Overall, 74 roads will be closed to vehicular traffic, 54 roads will only allow vehicular traffic going one way, 57 roads won't allow heavy vehicles and 114 locations will have parking restrictions. These restrictions will be in effect from 12:00 pm to 6:00 am.

139.title: J&K court refuses to dismiss UAPA case against college professor
139.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh HC refused to dismiss a case registered under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) against a college professor accused of inciting violence. Abdul Bari Naik has been charged with allegedly trying to provoke citizens to use force against the army and police. Police submitted video clips to court which purportedly showed Naik promoting enmity.

140.title: Car catches fire in Pune, lightning strike suspected reason
140.article_body: A car in the parking bay of an automobile sales company in Pune's Viman Nagar caught fire on Wednesday afternoon. The staffers at the facility said a lightning strike caused the fire, fire brigade officials said. No damages to other cars were reported in the incident. We brought the fire under control within minutes, said fire officer Sopan Pawar.

141.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra is a hollow, 'family-saving campaign': BJP
141.article_body: BJP on Wednesday termed Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as "hollow" and alleged that it was essentially a "family-saving campaign", for the Gandhis to keep control over the party. The family's political expanse has been shrinking while they face corruption charges, said BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad, adding that the campaign is another attempt at re-establishing Rahul Gandhi as a leader.

142.title: AAP releases 3rd list of 10 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
142.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has released the third list of 10 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. AAP has nominated former Congress leader Kailash Gadhvi from Mandvi Assembly seat in Kutch district, Dinesh Kapadia from Danilimda and Praful Vasava from Nandod. Kalpesh Patel Bholabhai, Jeevan Jungi and Lalesh Thakkar have been nominated from Vejalpur, Porbandar and Patan, respectively.

143.title: Water supply in some areas of eastern Pune to be disrupted on Sept 11
143.article_body: Water supply in some areas of eastern Pune will be disrupted on September 11 to facilitate the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited in carrying out urgent maintenance work. Pune Municipal Corporation informed that the affected areas include Viman Nagar, Vadgaon Sheri, Kalyani Nagar and Vishrantwadi. Water supply is likely to be restored late in the morning on September 12.

144.title: Release ₹383 cr for education & health pending for 2 yrs: Delhi LG to Kejriwal
144.article_body: Delhi LG V K Saxena has written to CM Arvind Kejriwal directing him to immediately release ₹383.74 crore for education and health sectors to municipal corporations pending for two years, Raj Niwas Delhi said in a statement on Wednesday. Holding the fund "without any reason" was adversely impacting primary education and health in Delhi, he reportedly said in the letter.

145.title: Mumbai man steals ₹15 cr from employer, loses all money in gambling
145.article_body: An accountant, who had stolen over ₹15 crore from his employer in Mumbai, lost all the money in online gambling, Borivali Police said. Kapil Ramanlal Khunt had siphoned the money from Mansi Shares and Stock Advisors' bank accounts. He went missing after informing the company's owners that he lost the money in gambling. Police found ₹16,437 in Khunt's bank account.

146.title: US bans 'advanced tech' firms from building facilities in China for 10 years
146.article_body: The US government announced technology companies that receive federal funding will be barred from building "advanced technology" facilities in China for 10 years. The guidelines were unveiled as part of a $50-billion plan aimed at building up local semiconductor industry. "Companies who receive...money can only expand mature node factories in China to serve...Chinese market," the White House said.

147.title: United Airlines may end JFK airport service if more flights not approved
147.article_body: United Airlines said it will end services to John F. Kennedy Airport (JFK) in October if the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) doesn't allow additional flights. In a statement, FAA said it must consider airspace and runway capacity to assess how changes would affect flights at nearby airports. United flies twice daily to San Francisco and Los Angeles from JFK.

148.title: 10 DMK MLAs are in touch with us to switch sides: AIADMK's EPS
148.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday claimed that 10 DMK MLAs are in touch with his faction to switch sides. "Though Tamil Nadu has many political parties, everyone has affection for AIADMK," Palaniswami said. EPS also alleged that AIADMK MP Ravindhranath, who is AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam's son, shares a close bond with DMK.

149.title: Bed Bath & Beyond names interim CFO after executive's death
149.article_body: Bed Bath & Beyond has named Laura Crossen as the interim Chief Financial Officer (CFO). She will continue serving as the company's principal accounting officer. According to the New York City Police Department, 52-year-old Gustavo Arnal fell from the 57-storey Jenga residential tower in Manhattan last week. The medical examiner's office said Arnal died by suicide.

150.title: I-T Dept raids business, residential premises of Raj Home Minister
150.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Wednesday conducted raids on business and residential premises belonging to Rajasthan Home Minister Rajendra Yadav and his family. The raids were conducted in Kotputli and Uttarakhand. The Congress MLA and his family have a business of packaging material and food products. "It's our ancestral business since 1950...My politics and business are both clean," Yadav said.

151.title: Hyderabad think tank demands toddy ban in city due to adulteration
151.article_body: A Hyderabad-based think tank has called for a complete ban on toddy sale in the city, alleging that it's adulterated. Citing the Toddy policy, the Forum for Good Governance (FGG) said that no palm trees exist within a 50 km radius of the city. The forum has also asked the state to chemically examine the toddy available in the market.

152.title: Hyderabad Mayor launches fever test program in NBT Nagar
152.article_body: Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal along with GHMC zonal commissioner of Khairatabad launched the fever test program in NBT Nagar where most number of dengue cases were registered. "At least every Sunday...for 10 minutes all the family members should participate in cleaning the surroundings," Gadwal said. She further urged people to be alert to prevent the spread of diseases during monsoons.

153.title: Dengue cases rise in Greater Hyd, govt launches door-to-door survey
153.article_body: As dengue cases rise in Greater Hyderabad and other parts of the state, the Telangana government has launched a door-to-door survey to create awareness about the disease. Over 1,800 cases were reported in August in the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits. GHMC officials will go from house to house and sanitise areas that are reporting higher cases.

154.title: Lost my father to politics of hate, won't lose country to it: Rahul
154.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said, "I lost my father to the politics of hate and division. I'll not lose my beloved country to it too." "Love will conquer hate. Hope will defeat fear," Gandhi tweeted. This comes after he paid tributes at his father and ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi's memorial in Tamil Nadu's Sriperumbudur ahead of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

155.title: Tencent raises stake in 'Assassin's Creed' maker Ubisoft
155.article_body: Chinese tech giant Tencent Holdings is raising its stake in France's Ubisoft Entertainment, the maker of 'Assassin's Creed' and 'Tom Clancy's' franchises. Tencent will pay €200 million euros ($198 million) to buy an indirect stake in Ubisoft and will invest a further €100 million in Guillemot Brothers. The pact involves Tencent's acquisition of 49.9% of Guillemot Brothers, Ubisoft said.

156.title: Fire breaks out in Noida Sector-18 building, dozen people saved from 2nd & 3rd floors
156.article_body: A fire broke out in a building in Noida Sector-18 market on Wednesday. Chief Fire Officer Arun Singh said, "A dozen people were stuck on the second and third floors of the building. We safely evacuated all of them. There were no casualties." He added that four fire tenders are deployed at the spot and the fire is under control.

157.title: Arshdeep is a confident guy & that's why he's here, ahead of a lot of people: Rohit
157.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma praised Arshdeep Singh for his performances, stating that the 23-year-old is a "confident guy" and they are happy with the way he approaches his game. "I haven't seen many people like that in their early days when they're playing for India," added Rohit. On Arshdeep's catch drop against Pakistan, Rohit said, "Arshdeep was himself disappointed."

158.title: IT Rules amendments to be rolled out in next few days: Union Minister
158.article_body: Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar said on Wednesday that the amendments to the Information Technology Rules, 2021 will be brought in the next few days. He added that a series of new legislation such as a revised bill on data protection and the Digital India Act will be rolled out in three-four months, however, these will be subject to stakeholder consultation.

159.title: Retail-tech startup Daalchini raises $4 million in Series A round
159.article_body: Retail-tech startup Daalchini has raised $4 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Unicorn India Ventures and saw participation from Artha Venture Fund, Ajay Kaul (former CEO of Domino's India) and Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's investment vertical. The startup was founded in 2017 by former Paytm employees Prerna Kalra and Vidya Bhushan.

160.title: Man tries to kidnap 6-yr-old girl from Mumbai's Ganpati mandal, fails
160.article_body: A man tried to kidnap a six-year-old girl playing at a Ganpati mandal near her home in Mumbai's Kandivali (East) on Tuesday, police said. The man allegedly picked her up on his shoulder on the pretext of showing her more Ganpati idols and started running away. He dropped the girl and escaped when the girl's father's friend confronted him.

161.title: Condemn Kejriwal's '80% of govt schools worse than junkyards' remark: Minister
161.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Tuesday criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for alleging that "80% of government schools in the country are worse than junkyards". "Since they've come to power in Delhi, the enrolment of students in government schools decreased," he said. It's unfortunate that those busy with liquor stores are calling schools junkyards, said BJP leader Anurag Thakur.

162.title: Former IT Secy joins Tiger Global-backed Ninjacart's advisory board
162.article_body: Tiger Global-backed agritech startup Ninjacart set up an advisory board comprising former Food and Agriculture Secretary T Nandakumar and J Satyanarayana, former Information Technology Secretary of the central government, among others. The advisory board will help in developing long-term strategies, the firm said. RBI's retired Deputy Governor Anand Sinha also joined the board.

163.title: Massive fire erupts at firecracker factory in UP's Bijnor; video surfaces
163.article_body: A massive fire broke out in a firecracker factory in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor on Wednesday. According to police, the fire may have started after a spark came in contact with the powder being filled inside the firecrackers. No injuries were reported from the fire. The fire was brought under control using the factory's own fire suppression provisions, police said.

164.title: Jewellery shop owner shot, stabbed to death on road in Ghaziabad
164.article_body: A 35-year-old jewellery store owner was shot and stabbed to death by two assailants on a road in Ghaziabad on Monday. The incident took place when the assailants tried to snatch the man's bag containing gold and silver jewellery. However, the locals managed to capture one of the shooters, while the second attacker was captured by police the next day.

165.title: Woman set afire by husband in Delhi after she refused to pay ₹5 lakh dowry
165.article_body: A 33-year-old woman was reportedly set ablaze by her husband and father-in-law over dowry in East Delhi's Mandawali. The accused reportedly poured kerosene on her and set her afire after she refused to pay them a ₹5 lakh dowry. She sustained 40% burn injuries. Delhi Commission for Women has sent a notice to the police demanding action against the accused.

166.title: Pune man slips while deboarding moving train; saved by RPF personnel
166.article_body: A man recently lost his balance and slipped on the platform while deboarding a moving train in Pune. A video shared by the Ministry of Railways showed the man coming close to the gap between the platform and the moving train when he's saved by Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel. "The vigilance of...RPF employee saved [his life]!" the ministry tweeted.

167.title: Venture capitalists invested $14.2 bn in crypto in H1 2022: Report
167.article_body: A Cointelegraph report found that venture capital (VC) firms contributed $14.2 billion into cryptocurrencies across 725 deals in H1 2022. According to KPMG, investments are likely to remain slow for the rest of the year. Majority of investments in H1 2022 reportedly came from Germany's Trade Republic, digital asset custody firm Fireblocks, cryptocurrency exchange FTX and software firm ConsenSys.

168.title: Bihar government to recycle seized liquor bottles into bangles
168.article_body: The Bihar government has decided to recycle the glass from seized liquor bottles into bangles. The state government has made an agreement with a bangle manufacturing unit in Uttar Pradesh that will train women in making bangles from these bottles. According to state excise commissioner, B Kartikey Dhanji, women engaged with Livelihood Mission (Jivika) would be employed for manufacturing bangles.

169.title: 2 arrested for theft, circulation of fake currency notes in B'luru
169.article_body: Police have arrested two people for alleged theft and circulating fake currency notes in Bengaluru. The accused had over 20 cases registered against them relating to house break-ins, burglary and chain snatching. Police have seized notes worth over ₹3 lakh from the suspects and 46 grams of gold. Two more were arrested for stealing bikes.

170.title: Set up grievance cells in each ward for those affected by floods: HC to BBMP
170.article_body: Karnataka HC on Wednesday directed Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to immediately set up cells to address grievances of those affected by heavy rains and a flood-like situation in Bengaluru. The cell, which will be set up in each ward, will have an engineer to attend to grievances. BBMP has been directed to expedite state government's approval for the cells.

171.title: Video shows MP health staffer getting massage from minor, gets notice
171.article_body: Health authorities have issued a show-cause notice to a hospital staffer after a video purportedly showed a minor boy massaging his legs in a government medical facility in MP's Shahdol, an official said on Wednesday. The incident occurred last week and the video surfaced online on Tuesday, in which the hospital staffer can be seen sitting on a chair.

172.title: How can India still qualify for Asia Cup final after losing to Sri Lanka?
172.article_body: After losing against Sri Lanka on Tuesday, India are currently third on Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage points table. India will require Pakistan to lose both their matches (against Afghanistan and Sri Lanka). India would also need to beat Afghanistan by a big margin. India would then need their NRR to be higher than that of Pakistan and Afghanistan.

173.title: Team management needs to take calls on Jadeja's workload: Karim
173.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has said not only Ravindra Jadeja but the team management also needs to take calls regarding the all-rounder's workload. "Jadeja is such a player who adds value in all three formats...It's very important for the medical team...to manage his workload," stated Karim. Jadeja has been ruled out of Asia Cup due to a knee injury.

174.title: Non-bailable warrant issued against Bobby Kataria over smoking video
