174.article_body: A Delhi court has issued a non-bailable warrant against social media influencer Bobby Kataria. A case was registered against him after a video showing him smoking a cigarette on board a SpiceJet flight in January went viral. Deputy Commissioner of Police, IGI Airport, Tanu Sharma, said Kataria has been on the run since the case was registered.

175.title: 18 underground Delhi metro stations to get full-height platform screen doors
175.article_body: A total of 18 underground stations of the upcoming Phase IV project of Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) are going to have full-height platform screen doors (PSD) like the ones used on the Airport Express Line stations. The full-height PSDs would operate as a complete glass barrier, and the doors would only open in sync with train doors.

176.title: 65-yr-old woman's body found in well in Thane; case registered
176.article_body: The body of a 65-year-old woman, Sharada Murlidhar Burse, was found in a well in Thane on Wednesday morning, a civic official said. Local police informed us that some persons had spotted the body floating in the well, Thane Municipal Corporation's Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief said. Police have registered a case of accidental death and are investigating it.

177.title: Agri-fintech firm Ayekart raises $5.5 mn in equity & debt fund round
177.article_body: Integrated tech firm Ayekart has secured $5.5 million through an equity and debt fund round from Caspian Debt, a corporate lending financial services company, and Siply, a micro financial services platform. The company aims to use the funds by providing businesses in the Food and Agriculture sector with financial and technological assistance. Ayekart began its commercial rollout in September 2021.

178.title: Best to tone down your expectation: Ashneer on EaseMyTrip Co-founder's chat with candidate
178.article_body: EaseMyTrip Co-founder Prashant Pitti recently shared a chat with a candidate who dropped out on the joining day. While Pitti called it a "prevalent" issue, BharatPe's ex-MD tweeted, "In India there's no value of contract...In India it’s- ek haath le doosre haath de. Best to tone down your expectation that you employ daily wagers in guise of salaried folk."

179.title: Video shows ambulance being made to wait for Amit Shah's convoy, Mumbai Police clarify
179.article_body: After a controversy erupted over a video purportedly showing an ambulance being made to wait for Union Home Minister Amit Shah's convoy to pass, Mumbai Police have issued a clarification. "It has been verified there was no emergency patient in the ambulance and due to defect, the ambulance van driver was unable to switch off the siren," Mumbai Police said.

180.title: 28-yr-old man attacked on suspicion of being police informer in Thane
180.article_body: A 28-year-old man was attacked by a gang of chain snatchers on suspicion of being a police informer in Thane, an official said. The incident occurred on Tuesday when Jaffar Yusuf (Ashok) Irani, was having food at a Ganesh pandal in Lahuji Nagar. The five accused allegedly sprayed something on Irani's face and attacked him with weapons, the official added.

181.title: Man killed by elephant in West Bengal's Jhargram, 7th death in 15 days
181.article_body: A 46-year-old man was trampled to death by a wild elephant in West Bengal's Jhargram district on Wednesday. The deceased, identified as Parimal Pal, was cutting a tree in a forest when he was attacked, officials said. Notably, this is the seventh person to be killed in attack by wild elephants in the district in last 15 days.

182.title: We support all peaceful efforts to end Russia-Ukraine conflict: PM
182.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday virtually addressed the Plenary Session of the 7th Eastern Economic Forum being held in Russia. Speaking on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, PM Modi said, "From the very beginning of the Ukraine conflict, we have emphasized the need to adopt the path of diplomacy and dialogue." "We support all peaceful efforts to end this conflict," he added.

183.title: 26-yr-old man killed in Chhattisgarh over suspicion of stealing utensils
183.article_body: Four men were arrested for allegedly killing a 26-year-old man over suspicion of stealing utensils in a village in the Jashpur district of Chhattisgarh, police said. They were booked under relevant sections of IPC. The accused purportedly hit the victim with sticks. "The victim was rushed to a nearby hospital where he died on Tuesday," a police official said.

184.title: India's digital revolution gives investment opportunities to US: FM
184.article_body: India's digital revolution offers investment opportunities for US firms and investors, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, adding that "India's Open Network for Digital Commerce has revolutionised the retail and manufacturing sector". Sitharaman said at the US-India Business Council's India Ideas Summit that she saw scope for collaboration between India and the US in the digital sector.

185.title: K'taka IT Minister to discuss B'luru flooding with software firms
185.article_body: Amid unprecedented rains in Bengaluru, Karnataka's Minister for Information Technology, Biotechnology CN Ashwathnarayan will meet the representatives of software companies on Wednesday to discuss the problems faced by the companies due to the rain. Companies such as Infosys, Wipro, Emphasis, Nasscom, Goldman Sachs, Intel, TCS, Philips and Sonata Software, among others will attend the meeting.

186.title: 73-yr-old man kills wife with bat in U'khand after she refused to make dinner
186.article_body: A 73-year-old man was arrested in Dehradun for allegedly beating his 53-year-old wife to death using a cricket bat on Monday evening, police said. The couple used to have frequent quarrels and a heated argument ensued between them after the woman refused to make dinner, police added. The accused called the ambulance. Later, doctors at the hospital declared her dead.

187.title: Pune residents use bridge before civic body's official inauguration
187.article_body: Pune residents have started using the bridge connecting Pashan to Sus Gaon before its official inauguration by the Pune Municipal Corporation, owing to the constant changing of completion dates, as per reports. "They gave us three deadlines- August 2021, August 15, 2022, and August 31...bridge was ready...it seems they have no one to officially inaugurate it," a resident said.

188.title: Policeman jumps off 12th-floor apartment with wife, daughter in Gujarat
188.article_body: A 35-year-old police constable allegedly jumped off his 12th-floor apartment along with his 28-year-old wife and their two-year-old daughter in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Wednesday, officials said. "He was a police constable posted at Vastrapur Police Station for the last three years," a policeman said. "We do not know the reason yet. An investigation is going on," he added.

189.title: Mumbai jail authority denies ex-CM Thackeray permission to meet Raut
189.article_body: Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail authority denied former CM Uddhav Thackeray the permission to meet jailed leader Sanjay Raut, who was arrested in connection with a money laundering case. The authority said that Thackeray would have to get court's permission for it. "They will have to meet in the same way as ordinary prisoners meet," it said.

190.title: You'll not get a better option than Shami for T20 WC: Irfan Pathan
190.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said if Team India wants to include another pacer in their preparation for the upcoming T20 World Cup, then they won't get a better option than Mohammad Shami. "There are options, but they are young and inexperienced. If you see experience and form, Mohammad Shami is furthest ahead," stated Irfan.

191.title: Country on 'Kartavya Path' but Congress on 'Ghulami Ka Parivar Path': Poonawalla
191.article_body: BJP's National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticised Congress after Robert Vadra's photo appeared on the poster of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said that the move is not about 'Bharat Jodo' but 'Parivar Ko Jodo'. Giving reference to the new name given to Rajpath, Poonawalla said, "Country is on Kartavya Path (path of duty) but Congress is on 'Ghulami Ka Parivar Path'."

192.title: Video shows crocodile roaming on streets in Shahjahanpur, triggers panic
192.article_body: A video showing a crocodile roaming around the streets in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur has gone viral on social media. The reptile reportedly moved out of a rainy drain and started roaming around the roads. Seeing the reptile on the road, the locals in Shahjahanpur reportedly panicked.

193.title: BJP leader, 21 others booked after man beaten to death in UP
193.article_body: A local BJP leader and 21 others were booked after a man was beaten to death in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi district on Tuesday. Police said an argument broke out when Mustqueem's goat strayed into his neighbour's house. Later at night, BJP leader Ashok Kumar Jaiswal and others allegedly barged into Mustqueem's home and thrashed him and his family, police added.

194.title: Maha CM to visit 12 Ganesh mandals, visit Nana Patekar in Pune on Wednesday
194.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde will offer prayers at more than a dozen Ganesh mandals in Pune and visit the residence of actor Nana Patekar on Wednesday, reports said. CM Shinde will offer prayers at the Ganesh idol installed by Patekar. Leaders of several political parties have been visiting the Ganesh mandals.

195.title: Parents rejected films after 'Iqbal' for me to have normal life: Shweta
195.article_body: Actress Shweta Basu Prasad, who featured as a child actress in the 2002 film 'Makdee' and the 2005 film 'Iqbal', said that her parents rejected several movies after 'Iqbal'. "They said no to Rajkumar Santoshi's 'Halla Bol' and Madhur Bhandarkar's 'Traffic Signal' because they wanted me to study and have a normal life," she revealed.

196.title: Who’s Jairam Ramesh? Was never close to any man with such name: Assam CM
196.article_body: Following Congress leader Jairam Ramesh's statement over Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' remark, Sarma said, "First, tell me who Jairam Ramesh is?" "I was never very close to any man with such a name when I was in Congress," Sarma added. Ramesh had said, "I think Assam CM is boyish and immature."

197.title: Govt to build another 46 km cycle track around Hyd's Gandipet: KTR
197.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao announced that the government is planning to build another 46 km cycle track around Gandipet. KTR made the announcement after laying foundation stone for solar-roofed cycling track in Hyderabad. "Ananthagiri Hills, Kotepally Lake and a portion of Vikarabad would also be transformed into tourist destinations," KTR added.

198.title: 1,240 people died in Pune in 2020 as they weren't wearing seatbelt: Data
198.article_body: According to data shared by the highway traffic police, not wearing seatbelts and helmets were among the major causes of road fatalities in Pune jurisdiction. As many as 1,240 people died in 2020 in Pune as they were not wearing seatbelts, according to the Maharashtra Highway Traffic Police website. Similarly, 4,878 people died in Pune as they weren't wearing helmets.

199.title: Working with Ekta Kapoor is an honour, have seen her grow up: Big B
199.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, speaking about working with producer Ekta Kapoor in his upcoming film 'Goodbye', has said that it was an honour to work with her. "I've seen Ekta growing up since her childhood...I've seen her films and have loved them," Amitabh added. Ekta said she visited Amitabh's house during her childhood as Shweta and Abhishek Bachchan were her friends.

200.title: I'm just devastated, it's heartbreaking: Kyrgios after US Open defeat
200.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said he's devastated after losing to Karen Khachanov in their US Open quarter-final. "I'm just devastated. Just feel like it was either winning it all or nothing at all...I feel like I've just failed at this event right now," he stated. Khachanov won with a scoreline of 7-5, 4-6, 7-5, 6-7 (3-7), 6-4.

201.title: Duo arrested for selling fake grocery products in Hyderabad
201.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested two people for operating a fake grocery-selling racket and seized items worth ₹6.74 lakh. The two accused bought fake grocery items from Rajasthan and sold them to retailers at a profit. The duo sold fake products like Red Label tea powder, Chakra Gold tea powder, Parachute oil and Lizol among other popular household brand products.

202.title: Arshdeep Singh stops and stares at man abusing him in front of team bus, video goes viral
202.article_body: India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh stopped and stared at a man who abused him while he was boarding the team bus after India's defeat to Sri Lanka on Tuesday. In the video, the man can be heard mocking Arshdeep for dropping a catch against Pakistan. Senior journalist Vimal Kumar confronted the man for his behaviour after which the man apologised.

203.title: Chelsea sack manager Thomas Tuchel after 100 days of new ownership
203.article_body: Chelsea today sacked their manager Thomas Tuchel after the club suffered a defeat against Dinamo Zagreb in their first Champions League match this season. "As the new ownership group reaches 100 days since taking over the club, and as it continues its hard work to take the club forward...new owners believe it's...right time to make this transition," the club said.

204.title: Pet dog attacks man in Noida housing society lift after Ghaziabad incident, video surfaces
204.article_body: After a video showing a pet dog biting a boy inside a housing society lift in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad went viral, another video of a dog attack in Noida has surfaced. The latest incident occurred in Apex Athena society in Sector 75 in Noida, where a man was attacked in the lift by a pet dog of a boy.

205.title: Arvind Kejriwal writes letter to PM, says '80% of govt schools are worse than junkyards'
205.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, saying that 80% of government schools in India are worse than junkyards. Referring to the Pradhan Mantri Schools For Rising India (PM-SHRI) scheme for upgradation of 14,500 government schools, Kejriwal noted that there are more than 10 lakh government schools in India and stated that all should be upgraded together.

206.title: Spreading hate in name of caste, religion can lead to civil war: Raj CM
206.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday criticised BJP, claiming hate has spread in the country in the name of caste and religion and it can lead to a civil war if it remains unchecked. "We will all work together under Rahul Gandhi's leadership'', Gehlot said, adding that it will be easier to solve big challenges if Gandhi becomes party chief.

207.title: Thieves dressed as policemen rob jewellery, cash worth ₹50 lakh in Bihar
207.article_body: Thieves dressed as policemen robbed a trader of jewellery and cash worth ₹50 lakh while he was on his way to Bihar's Chhapra Junction. The victim said the thieves asked him to accompany them as there was a complaint against him. They then tied his hands and covered his eyes before looting his bag containing the jewellery and cash.

208.title: Jharkhand CM plays drum during tribal harvest festival in Ranchi
208.article_body: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren was spotted playing a traditional drum called mandar in Ranchi on Tuesday evening on the occasion of Karam Puja, a tribal harvest festival. A video showed onlookers cheering and clapping as Soren played the traditional instrument. This comes after Soren won the trust vote in the Jharkhand Assembly on Monday.

209.title: Juul to pay $438.5 million to settle US states' probe into underage vaping marketing
209.article_body: Juul Labs has agreed to pay $438.5 million in a settlement following an investigation lasting two years by at least 33 US' states into the electric cigarette maker's marketing of vaping products containing high levels of nicotine. The states claimed that Juul's marketing downplayed its products' risks and targeted underage buyers. The FDA had briefly banned Juul's e-cigarettes in June.

210.title: Minor dies while undergoing treatment for stomach pain in Noida; doctor booked
210.article_body: Police have booked a doctor from a clinic in Sarfabad village in Noida's Sector 72 for negligence after a 15-year-old boy died while undergoing treatment for stomach pain. "The accused gave him some medicines pursuant to which he fell...sick and succumbed to his illness," a police official said. "We're investigating if...medical degree of the accused is authentic," he added.

211.title: Need to improve infrastructure: Goenka on video of flooded luxury apartment in B'luru
211.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka took to Twitter to share a video of flooding in Epsilon, an upscale residential apartment in Bengaluru. He wrote, "Scenes from the finest housing society Epsilon...where the rich and famous stay. If the city wants to continue the moniker of 'IT capital of the world', we've to improve the infrastructure of the city."

212.title: AAP MP Sanjay Singh tears legal notice sent by Delhi LG; party shares video
212.article_body: AAP on Wednesday shared a video of its Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh tearing the legal notice sent by Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena. Saxena had sent the notice over allegations Singh made against him in connection with the ₹1,400-crore 'Khadi scam'. While tearing the notice, Singh said, "The Constitution of India gives me the right to speak the truth."

213.title: Catfight is misogynistic term, do we call men fighting 'dog fight'?: Huma
213.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi has said that 'catfight' is a misogynistic term. "Men also fight, we don't call them dog fights, do we? People fight because they don't get along and it's not about their gender," she added. Huma further added, "I think a lot more is made out about women competing with each other. I think men compete far more."

214.title: Deserves to be reunited with family: HC grants bail to boy booked for gangrape
214.article_body: The Bombay HC, while granting bail to a boy booked for the gangrape of a seven-year-old girl in 2020, said that a child can't be denied the right to be reunited with his family. The court last month said that the applicant's education can't be discontinued further and that being reunited with his family will allow him to develop himself.

215.title: 33 contractors fined ₹50 lakh over poor quality of roads in Pune
215.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has fined 33 contractors ₹50 lakh during the defect liability period over poor quality of the roads in the city. According to the civic body officials, contractors are fined ₹5,000 for every square metre of pothole. "The list of bad contractors is currently being put together. They shall receive harsh punishment," a PMC official said.

216.title: 11 Karnataka education officials arrested in teachers' recruitment case
216.article_body: Karnataka Police arrested 11 education officials on Tuesday in connection with the alleged irregularities in the grade-2 assistant teachers' recruitment process in 2012-13 and 2014-15. Those arrested are accused of illegally recruiting two assistant teachers in Tumkur. In 2014-15, 11 "unqualified" teachers were recruited under grade-2 assistant teachers and grade-1 language teachers categories.

217.title: Madrassas demolished in Assam were Al-Qaeda offices: CM Sarma
217.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday said that all madrassas that were recently demolished in the state were "not madrassas but Al-Qaeda offices". "We demolished two-three and now the public is coming to demolish others. Muslim community is coming to demolish, saying that they don't want a madrassa where the work of Al-Qaeda is done," he said.

218.title: Trying to fix something that's not broken: Uthappa on India's approach
218.article_body: Talking about India's defeats in the ongoing Asia Cup, Robin Uthappa said India are trying "too many things" in their recent matches. "[They're] trying to fix something that is not broken," stated Uthappa. "Be as aggressive as you want, but if you don't have wickets at the back end, you're always going to be under the pump," he added.

219.title: BJP's Rath Yatra was for satta, Congress' Bharat Jodo is for satya: Kanhaiya
219.article_body: BJP's 1990 Rath Yatra was for seeking "satta (power)", but Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is for "satya (truth)", Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar said on Wednesday. "It represents the thinking of the country that is enshrined in the Preamble of the Constitution," Kanhaiya added. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will launch the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari at around 5 pm today.

220.title: Drunk domestic help kills J'khand couple in sleep after fight over food
220.article_body: A 40-year-old man, in a drunk state, allegedly axed a couple to death in their sleep and critically injured their daughter, following an argument over food in Jharkhand's Gumla district, police said. The accused said that he had an argument with the deceased a few days back and feared that his employer would murder him, a police official said.

221.title: Thane man kills mother, hangs her body from fan to pass it off as suicide
221.article_body: A 34-year-old man was booked for allegedly killing his 50-year-old mother in Thane. The accused reportedly strangulated her on Monday morning following a quarrel and later hung her body from a ceiling fan with a cloth to pass it off as a case of suicide. The accused used to have frequent quarrels with the deceased over domestic and monetary issues.

222.title: Parts of Pakistan look like a sea: Pak PM as deaths rise to 1,343
222.article_body: Parts of Pakistan look "like a sea", Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said as the death toll from devasting floods in the country rose to 1,343. "We will need trillions of rupees to cope with this calamity," he added. As many as 33 million of Pakistan's 220 million population have been affected by the disaster blamed on climate change.

223.title: Volvo bus skids on slippery road amid rain in B'luru, video surfaces
223.article_body: A video of a Volvo bus skidding on Bengaluru-Mysuru expressway amid heavy rain has gone viral on the internet. The bus can be seen sliding haphazardly, before regaining control and speeding away as a truck lay on its side after having undergone an accident. As many as five people have died because of heavy rain in Karnataka since Sunday.

224.title: Impossible to isolate Russia, we will turn to Middle East: Putin
224.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin, while speaking at an economic forum in Vladivostok, said it would be "impossible" to isolate Russia. He said Russia sees more opportunities in entering markets in the Middle East after the West imposed sanctions in response to the invasion of Ukraine. "Moscow would defy the West's attempts to push Russia off the global stage," he added.

225.title: Anthony Joshua accepts Tyson Fury's 'battle of Britain' WBC title fight
225.article_body: Boxer Anthony Joshua has accepted Tyson Fury's challenge to fight in a "battle of Britain" match for the WBC heavyweight championship. Fury, who earlier said he had retired, said he's offering "belt-less" Joshua an opportunity to win the crown. Joshua, who suffered a second consecutive defeat to Ukrainian Oleksandr Usyk recently, responded by saying he will be "ready in December".

226.title: Will be easier to deal with big challenges if Rahul becomes Cong chief: Gehlot
226.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said there are big challenges before the country and if Rahul Gandhi becomes party chief, it will be easier to deal with them. "We'll all work together under Rahul Gandhi's leadership," Gehlot added. "There's so much polarisation, hate has been created in name of...religion. If this isn't controlled, it can go towards civil war," he added.

227.title: Man to cover 770 km on foot from Guj to Mumbai to see Lalbaugcha Raja
227.article_body: A 44-year-old education inspector is set to cover 770 km on foot from Gujarat's Junagadh district to Mumbai to see Lalbaugcha Raja, the idol of Lord Ganesha at Lalbaug. Samir Jagdishbhai Datani started his expedition on August 13 and reached Mira Road on Tuesday after walking for about 25 days. He is expected to reach his destination today (Wednesday).

228.title: Data-entry operator jumps off civic centre building in Delhi, dies
228.article_body: A man working as a data-entry operator with the Income Tax Department allegedly jumped to death from the Shyama Prasad Mukherjee Civic Centre building in New Delhi on Wednesday, police said. He jumped from the building's top floor, Indian Express reported quoting sources. DCP (Central district) Shweta Chauhan said the deceased has been identified and concerned authorities have been contacted.

229.title: 2 youths drown during Ganpati visarjan in Gadhi river in Panvel
229.article_body: Two youths reportedly drowned in Gadhi river in Panvel during Ganpati visarjan on Monday. Vikram Jamdar, 19, fell into the river after losing his balance while immersing Ganesh idol in the river. Following this, his 20-year-old cousin Shekhar jumped into the water to save him but was also swept away. The duo had gone to the river with 5-6 people.

230.title: Had India fielded first vs SL, things would've been different: Pujara
230.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara has said if India had won the toss and fielded first against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup Super 4 match, then the result would've been different. "I feel for the Indian team...I feel that the toss is playing a big factor in this Asia Cup," he stated. India lost the match by six wickets.

231.title: Haaland alone won't win us the Champions League: Man City manager
231.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said the team cannot solely rely on Erling Haaland to win them the Champions League. "All the players who come here were brought...to make us better. If we rely on Erling's shoulders, we will not win...Champions League," said Guardiola. Manchester City defeated Sevilla 4-0 in their opening Champions League match of the season on Tuesday.

232.title: NHAI to bear 80% land acquisition cost for Pune Ring Road
232.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has decided to bear 80% land acquisition cost for the proposed Pune Ring Road. The authority has appealed the Maharashtra government to bear the remaining cost. According to Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, the 170-km-long Pune Ring Road will help traffic coming from other cities to reach destination without passing through Pune city.

233.title: Ranbir, Alia not stopped at temple, they decided not to visit because of protest: Minister
233.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has said nobody stopped Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt at Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar temple. He said, "Like Ayan Mukerji paid his visit to the temple, Ranbir and Alia were also requested to visit but they decided not to go because of the protest. An artist should not use words which hurt the sentiments of people."

234.title: Whale vomit worth ₹10 crore seized, 4 men arrested in UP; pics released
234.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police Special Task Force (STF) arrested four members of a gang involved in smuggling of ambergris (whale vomit) in Lucknow. Police seized 4.12-kg whale vomit worth ₹10 crore in the operation. The sale of whale vomit, which is a sought-after ingredient for perfumes, is banned under Wildlife (Protection) Act of 1972.

235.title: Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan becomes world number one T20I batter, 3 Indians in top 20
235.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan has become the world number one T20I batter, displacing his compatriot Babar Azam from the top spot in the last rankings. Rizwan is only the third Pakistan batter to top the rankings for T20I batters after Babar and Misbah-ul-Haq. Suryakumar Yadav (fourth), Rohit Sharma (14th) and Ishan Kishan (19th) are the three Indians in top 20.

236.title: Probe ordered to check legality of 49 film studios in Mumbai
236.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) ordered an inquiry into the legality of 49 film studios located in Madh, Marve, Erangal, Bhati and Malad. BMC's order came after it received multiple complaints saying that the studios were illegally built in the No-Development Zone (NDZ) and Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ). Majority of the studios were built between 2021 and 2022.

237.title: Drinking water in B'luru to be restored on Wednesday: K'taka CM
237.article_body: Normal supply of drinking water in Bengaluru, which had been disrupted since Monday following heavy rainfall, will be restored on Wednesday, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai had announced. "Two pump houses had stopped functioning at TK Halli on Monday, affecting the water supply to Bengaluru," CM Bommai said, adding that the issue has been resolved now.

238.title: IIT Kanpur student found dead in hostel room
238.article_body: A PhD student of IIT Kanpur, Prasant Singh, was found dead inside his hostel room on Tuesday. The incident came to light when a hostel resident informed the security that Singh's room was locked from inside and there was no response to knocks. When the institute's administration forced the door open, he was found hanging from the ceiling.

239.title: Russia hasn't lost anything over its military campaign in Ukraine: Putin
239.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that Russia hasn't "lost anything" over its military campaign in Ukraine. "In terms of what we've gained, I can say that the main gain has been...strengthening of our sovereignty," he added. However, Putin admitted that Russia's decision to send troops into Ukraine had created a "certain polarisation, both in the world and within the country".

240.title: Nasdaq top exec to meet FM to discuss listing of Indian firms in US
240.article_body: Nasdaq Executive Vice-Chairman Edward Knight said that he will meet Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to discuss the listing of Indian companies in the US. "India should allow initial listing of companies on US stock exchanges," said Knight. He added that India has 260 unicorns ready to go public and that he would like to set up a startup-to-unicorn pipeline.

241.title: Video shows elderly woman selling snacks on Mumbai local; social media users offer help
241.article_body: A video showing an elderly woman selling snacks on a Mumbai local train has gone viral. Social media users praised the elderly woman and enquired for her contact details to extend help. The video was shared by Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal, who wrote, "This woman and thousands of people like her work hard to earn bread."

242.title: BESCOM received over 32,000 distress calls between Sept 4-5
242.article_body: More than 32,000 power outage complaints were received between Sunday and Monday (September 4-5) as there was an electricity shut down in several apartments and societies in Bengaluru due to heavy rainfall, the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) said. The power supply was suspended in these apartments and localities as a precautionary measure to avoid short-circuit incidents.

243.title: 'Brahmastra' sells over 1.30 lakh tickets despite boycott trend on Twitter
243.article_body: Amid the boycott trend on Twitter and protests against the film 'Brahmastra', the film managed to sell 1.31 lakh tickets at the national chains through advance booking for the opening day till September 7. As per Pinkvilla, the three national chains have sold over 2.50 lakh tickets for the movie for the opening weekend. 'Brahmastra' will feature Ranbir Kapoor.

244.title: Those who divided India now talking about 'Bharat jodo': BJP spokesperson
244.article_body: Commenting on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress has only done 'Bharat todo'. "Rahul Gandhi and First Family have always believed in undermining Sardar Patel and never celebrated his efforts…From 1947 to now…Those who divided India are now talking about 'Bharat jodo'," Poonawalla tweeted. "This is 'bhrashtachar jodo' not 'Bharat jodo'," he added.

245.title: India means opportunities, entire 21st century is India's: Goyal
245.article_body: Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said that India meant "opportunities" and it is not just this decade but the entire 21st century belongs to India. He was interacting with the faculty and students of the Stanford Graduate School of Business in San Francisco. Goyal is on a six-day visit to the US for various programmes.

246.title: French lawmakers visit Taiwan as tensions with China escalate
246.article_body: A delegation of five French lawmakers, led by Senator Cyril Pellevat, arrived in Taiwan on Wednesday. The lawmakers will meet high-ranking officials, including Taiwan's Vice President Lai Ching-te and Legislative Speaker You Si-Kun, to discuss security and innovation. This is first high-level European delegation to visit Taiwan since US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited despite China's warnings.

247.title: India's plan to shift to renewables has received a jolt: Sitharaman
247.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India's plans for transition to renewables have received a jolt. Addressing the US-India Business Council summit, Sitharaman said, "There are huge uncertainties over availability of crude, natural gas and coal due to the (Russia-Ukraine) war" because of which many nations, including India, are mulling going back to coal to meet their energy needs.

248.title: Dinesh Karthik can't finish games by sitting in the dressing room: Sehwag
248.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has questioned Deepak Hooda's inclusion in Team India's XI ahead of Dinesh Karthik in their Asia Cup Super 4 matches against Pakistan and Sri Lanka. "I can't understand the logic of Hooda's selection...Karthik can't finish games by sitting in the dressing room," stated Sehwag. Hooda didn't bowl in both the matches and scored 16 and 3.

249.title: Promoter says Bieber's India concert to go ahead as planned amid his break
249.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber announced he will be taking a break from performances across the world to put his health first. Earlier, Bieber had revealed he was suffering from Ramsay Hunt Syndrome. However, one of the promoters of Bieber's India concert stated the Asia leg of the Justice Tour, which includes his show in India in October, will continue as scheduled.

250.title: Suspect in Canada stabbing case had 59 criminal convictions: Documents
250.article_body: Myles Sanderson, an alleged attacker involved in killing 10 people in Canada, has 59 criminal convictions, parole documents said. Sanderson had been serving a sentence of four years and four months on charges including assault with a weapon. Public Safety Minister Marco Mendicino said that many of Sanderson’s past crimes happened when he was intoxicated.

251.title: Congress' politics confined to attacking PM, Centre: Maha minister
251.article_body: Maharashtra Revenue Minister Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil on Wednesday said Congress party's politics revolved around attacking the Centre while keeping larger party-related and public issues on the back-burner. "To retain its identity, it has to show it is doing something. So, the easiest thing to draw attention is to attack the Prime Minister Narendra Modi government," Patil added.

252.title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 2% amid reports of multiple block deals
252.article_body: Bharti Airtel shares opened 2% lower after reports of multiple block deals of 1.09% stake. Nearly 10.4 crore shares worth ₹7,906 crore changed hands at ₹750 apiece. Reuters had reported in August that Singapore Telecommunications would sell a 3.3% stake in Airtel to Bharti Telecom in the next three months. At 12 pm, Airtel was trading at ₹746.60 on BSE.

253.title: After Ranbir-Alia denied temple entry, MP posts celebs' pic with PM, says 'it won't help'
253.article_body: After Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt were reportedly stopped from entering into Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar temple by Bajrang Dal, Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi posted a photo of Bollywood celebrities with PM Narendra Modi. Chaturvedi wrote, "None of this photo op will help if you'll continue to be mute spectators to hate & believe it's not your business to talk politics."

254.title: Tejashwi Yadav makes surprise visit to govt hospitals in Patna, video surfaces
254.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday night made a surprise visit to Patna Medical College Hospital (PMCH), New Gardiner Road Hospital and Gardanibagh Hospital. "The condition of PMCH's Tata ward is getting worse," Tejashwi, who is also the state Health Minister, said. "There were no medicine arrangements...patients were not being provided facilities...negligence was seen," he stated.

255.title: Rajpath conveys you've come for 'Raj': Lekhi on renaming Rajpath to 'Kartavya Path'
255.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said that name of Rajpath has been changed to 'Kartavya Path' because Rajpath conveys you've come for 'Raj'. "We carried forward colonial mindset after Independence...PM said that country is celebrating 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' and we've to end imperialistic policies, symbols. So, the name of Rajpath has been changed," the BJP leader said.

256.title: US actress Megan Hilty's sister, brother-in-law and their kid die in seaplane crash
256.article_body: US actress Megan Hilty's sister Lauren Hilty, brother-in-law Ross Mickel, and their child Remy were among the 10 people who died in a seaplane crash in Mutiny Bay on Sunday. Lauren was pregnant with a baby boy, who was going to be named Luca, according to TMZ. It is currently unknown what caused the crash.

257.title: No sense to buy Twitter if we're heading into World War III: Musk's leaked text
257.article_body: Amid their lawsuit, Twitter's lawyer revealed a text sent by Tesla CEO Elon Musk to a banker, alleging that Musk was looking for a way out of the deal and that his claims on spam accounts were merely a pretext to end it. The message read, "It won't make sense to buy Twitter if we're heading into World War III."

258.title: Fire breaks out at showroom in Guwahati; cars, bikes worth ₹1.5 cr burnt
258.article_body: A fire broke out at a Benelli and Isuzu showroom in Assam's Guwahati. Isuzu cars worth at least ₹1.5 crore were burnt and Benelli bikes worth ₹6-7 lakh were burnt, a showroom employee said. "Totalling with the property loss, we hit a ₹4-5 crore loss," the employee added. As many as eight fire tenders were rushed to the site.

259.title: Govt staff to get salary today, no lack of funds: Punjab minister
259.article_body: Asserting that there is no shortage of funds, Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema on Wednesday said that state government's employees will get their salaries by evening. "[The] Punjab government made 9,000 contractual employees permanent, due to which the process of giving out salaries…got delayed by three-four days," said Cheema. He added that 18,000 new recruitments have been done.

260.title: He's boyish, immature: Jairam over Assam CM's remark on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
260.article_body: Following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's "Congress should start 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Pakistan" remark, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said, "He's a recent migrant to BJP, so he has to make outrageous statements every day." He added, "I don't take Assam CM seriously...I think Assam CM is boyish, immature...makes statements only to prove his loyalty to his new masters."

261.title: Pune's Yerawada, Kothrud reported highest noise level this Ganeshotsav: MPCB
261.article_body: Pune's Yerawada and Kothrud reported highest noise levels in the city during Ganesh festival this year, according to Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB). As per MPCB data, Yerawada recorded the highest average noise level at 84.69 decibels, followed by Kothrud and Shaniwar Peth at 84.68 and 83.67 decibels, respectively. This year, noise pollution was monitored at 18 locations across Pune.

262.title: Didn't know much about Vicky, was won over when I met him: Katrina
262.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', said that her relationship with Vicky Kaushal was "unexpected and out of the blue". "I didn't even know much about Vicky. He was just a name I had heard...But when I met him, I was won over," she added. Vicky and Katrina tied the knot in December 2021.

263.title: I attempted to make 'Ponniyin...' but Mani Ratnam succeeded: Kamal Haasan
263.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan has revealed MGR had given him the rights to make 'Ponniyin Selvan'. "I knew that either Mani Ratnam or I would make 'Ponniyin Selvan'. I attempted but Mani succeeded," Kamal added. Speaking about the time he wanted to make the film, Kamal stated Sivaji felt Rajinikanth would be perfect for 'Vandhiyathevan', whereas, he would play Aditya Karikalan.

264.title: Where is India broken?: BJP leader on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
264.article_body: Former UP Cabinet Minister Sidharth Nath Singh criticised Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said that he has a problem with the terminology of Congress. "Where is India broken, which Congress have come out to connect? India is not disintegrated...then how can you say so?" he added. "You had divided India on the basis of your issues," the BJP leader said.

265.title: Nothing can be better than this feeling: Anil on becoming grandparent
265.article_body: Speaking about becoming a grandparent, actor Anil Kapoor has said that he is always there by his newborn grandchild's side. Last month, Anil's daughter and actress Sonam Kapoor welcomed a baby boy. "Nothing can be better than this feeling. I would like to say my dialogue (from 'Dil Dhadakne Do'), 'I feel on top of the world'," he added.

266.title: US returns 58 looted antiquities worth $19 million to Italy
266.article_body: The US returned 58 stolen antiquities worth an estimated $19 million to Italy on Tuesday. The items, many on display at the New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art for years, included vases, platters and 'The Marble Head of Athena' worth an estimated $3 million. The antiquities were sold by convicted looters who used locals to raid unguarded sites in Italy.

267.title: Musk doesn't come to me for advice on how to fail to buy Twitter: Gaiman on Musk's tweet
267.article_body: After a Twitter user asked author Neil Gaiman's opinion on Tesla CEO not liking 'The Rings of Power' series, the 'Sandman' writer tweeted, "Elon Musk doesn't come to me for advice on how to fail to buy Twitter, and I don't go to him for film, TV or literature criticism." Notably, Musk had tweeted, "Tolkien is turning in his grave."

268.title: Are you kidding me: EaseMyTrip Co-founder shares chat with candidate refusing to join
268.article_body: EaseMyTrip Co-founder Prashant Pitti took to Twitter to share a screenshot of a chat with a candidate after the latter dropped out on the joining day. Pitti replied to the candidate’s text, "Are you kidding me?" and in the caption wrote, "Someone please solve this hiring issue. This is hugely prevalent and ends up wasting so much time and resource."

269.title: UP teacher punches Class 2 Dalit student, rubs his head on ground
269.article_body: A seven-year-old Dalit student studying in Class 2 was allegedly punched and his head was rubbed on the ground by a teacher in a government primary school in UP's Bhadohi district on Tuesday. According to police, the boy was playing in the school ground when the incident occurred. The student suffered an injury near his right eye, added police.

270.title: We're not the underdogs anymore: SL's Bhanuka Rajapaksa after win over India
270.article_body: After their six-wicket win over India in their Asia Cup Super 4 match, Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa said, "We're not underdogs anymore." He added, "We want to win the title. We are pretty confident, we are backing our team." Rajapaksa remained unbeaten at 25 off 17 deliveries to help Sri Lanka chase down India's 174-run target.

271.title: Only clay idols allowed immersion at Hyd's Hussain Sagar: Telangana govt
271.article_body: Telangana government issued a clarification around Ganesh idol immersion at Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar on Tuesday and said that the immersion of only clay idols is permitted in the lake. The state government further clarified that idols made out of Plaster of Paris (PoP) are prohibited for immersion in the lake due to a High Court's order dated July 21, 2022.

272.title: Spewing venom: Baghel on Assam CM's 'start Bharat Jodo Yatra in Pak' remark
272.article_body: Following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's "Congress should start 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Pakistan" remark, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said, "He's spewing venom." Baghel added, "He must have visited RSS office and seen Akhand Bharat's map. BJP says Muslims [should] be sent to Pakistan and merge it for Akhand Bharat. What does it mean to send them and merge later?"

273.title: 5 cows killed, 10 injured after truck overturns in Bihar's Sasaram
273.article_body: Five cows were killed and 10 injured after a truck, in which they were allegedly being smuggled, overturned in Bihar's Sasaram on Tuesday. The injured cows were rescued by the police and are being treated with the help of the animal husbandry department, said a police official. The locals caught a person and handed him over to the police.

274.title: Mother of US school shooting victim posts pic of daughter's grave as school reopens
274.article_body: Students went back to US' Robb Elementary school for the first time since the shooting that killed 19 kids and two teachers. In a tweet, Kimberly Garcia, whose daughter Amerie Jo Garza was among the deceased, wrote, "I don't get to post back to school photos of you." Garcia wrote this along with a picture of her daughter's grave.

275.title: Sidhu Moosewala's father gets death threat, mail demanding money
275.article_body: In a complaint made to the police, Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh has stated that he got a mail wherein a threat was made to his life and money was demanded from him. The person who sent the mail, which was in Hindi, said that Singh should stop speaking against Lawrence Bishnoi and Goldy Brar.

276.title: US woman killed by bull shark while snorkeling in Bahamas
276.article_body: A US woman was killed in a shark attack while snorkeling in the Bahamas on Tuesday. The victim, who was a passenger on a Royal Caribbean cruise ship, was attacked by the shark while "on an independent shore excursion" in Nassau, cruise officials said. Last month, an eight-year-old British boy survived an attack by three sharks in the Bahamas.

277.title: Should know his age: Maha CM on Aaditya Thackeray's 'traitor' remark
277.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, while reacting to Aaditya Thackeray's 'traitor' remark for rebel Shiv Sena leaders, said the latter "should know his age and speak accordingly". "What we're today is because of...late Balasaheb Thackeray and his school of thought. But he (Aaditya) and others drifted...from Balasaheb's thought for power which forced us to take this strong step," Shinde added.

278.title: Karen Khachanov knocks Kyrgios out of US Open after 5-set quarter-final win
278.article_body: World number 31 Karen Khachanov defeated Australian Nick Kyrgios in three hours and 39 minutes in US Open quarter-final on Wednesday. Khachanov won with the scoreline of 7-5, 4-6, 7-5, 6-7(3-7), 6-4 to enter the first Grand Slam semi-final of his career. The 26-year-old Russian will now face Norway's Casper Ruud for a place in the final on Friday night.

279.title: Teen kills father with a rolling pin after latter abuses wife in Delhi
279.article_body: Delhi Police apprehended a 17-year-old boy for allegedly killing his 42-year-old father with a wooden rolling pin at their home in the Sarai Rohilla area. The incident took place in August after the boy found his father abusing his mother, police said. The minor told the police that he only wanted to teach his father a lesson.

280.title: Nissan Motors to buy automotive battery firm Vehicle Energy Japan
280.article_body: Japan's Nissan Motor said it will acquire all the common shares in Vehicle Energy Japan held by the lithium-ion battery maker's biggest shareholder, Innovation Network Corporation of Japan. After the acquisition, Vehicle Energy Japan will become Nissan's consolidated subsidiary and will hold shares alongside Maxell and Hitachi Astemo. Financial details of the deal are yet to be known.

281.title: B'luru's Epsilon housing Wipro's Premji, Byju's CEO, submerged; residents evacuated
281.article_body: Bengaluru’s upscale gated apartment, Epsilon, which houses billionaires like Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji and Byju Raveendran, has been submerged under water. Videos on social media showed inflatable boats being used to evacuate residents from their apartments while cars and other vehicles were surrounded by water. Notably, a basic villa in Epsilon costs ₹10 crore.

282.title: Influential political families' vested interests deprived Punjab youth from jobs: CM
282.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said Punjab has lagged behind in the process of development and youth had been deprived of employment opportunities because of the vested interests of influential political families. "The hands of these families are drenched with treachery and ruining the future of younger generations. These families connived with forces for getting personal benefits," CM Mann added.

283.title: 30,000 from Myanmar took refuge in Mizoram since 2021 coup: Govt
283.article_body: As many as 30,401 people from Myanmar have taken refuge in Mizoram since the military coup in the country in February last year, said state Home Minister Lalchamliana. The government has provided identity cards and refugee certificates to 30,177 of them. So far, ₹3 crore relief has been disbursed by the state for them, added the minister.

284.title: Ratnam is 1st pan-India director, Roja & Bombay reached entire India: Shankar
284.article_body: During an event for 'Ponniyin Selvan', filmmaker Shankar said that Mani Ratnam is the first pan-India director. "His films like 'Roja' and 'Bombay' reached all over India because of his style, work ethic and work. We are travelling on the path...discovered by Mani sir," Shankar added. Ratnam's upcoming film 'Ponniyin Selvan' features actors Vikram and Karthi.

285.title: 3 men pose as NSG commandos to cheat people, arrested in Gurugram
285.article_body: Gurugram Police on Tuesday arrested a gang of three men who posed as commandos of the National Security Guard (NSG) to cheat people. The accused directly called people and cheated them on the pretext of selling furniture, police said. The incident came to light after Rambir, a resident of Dhana village, was cheated of ₹15,000 by the accused, police added.

286.title: New UK PM vows to cut taxes, strengthen NHS and tackle energy crisis
286.article_body: In her debut speech outside the 10 Downing Street, UK's new Prime Minister Liz Truss said she would cut taxes to spur economic growth, strengthen the National Health Service (NHS) and deal with the energy crisis "hands on". Truss has named the top members of her team including Therese Coffey, UK's first female Deputy Prime Minister.

287.title: Lawrence reveals she had 2 miscarriages, including one alone in Canada in her early 20s
287.article_body: Actress Jennifer Lawrence, in an interview with Vogue, revealed that she had two miscarriages. She said that her first miscarriage occurred when she was in her early 20s, adding that she was then alone in Canada's Montreal. Her second miscarriage happened a couple of years ago. She gave birth to her first child in February this year.

288.title: 17-year-old girl accuses Nepal cricket captain Sandeep Lamichhane of raping her in hotel
288.article_body: Nepal cricket team captain Sandeep Lamichhane, who has previously played for Delhi Capitals in the IPL, has been accused of raping a 17-year-old girl. The girl has alleged that 22-year-old Lamichhane raped her in a hotel room in Kathmandu on August 21, a day before Lamichhane left for the bilateral series with Kenya. Police have begun investigation into the matter.

289.title: Father of child bitten by dog in Ghaziabad society lift confronts dog owner, video surfaces
289.article_body: After a video from Ghaziabad went viral where a dog bit a child inside a housing society's lift, another video has surfaced online showing the child's father confronting the dog owner. In the video, the woman is seen walking her dog in the building's basement and the man is heard saying that she is refusing to reveal her flat number.

290.title: UP's Bareilly DM bans wearing jeans, T-shirts in office
290.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly District Magistrate Shivakant Dwivedi has ordered a ban on wearing casual attire such as jeans, T-shirts in office. "Government employees and officers should wear formal attire to make them look like they are officers. Those who have to wear casuals can wear it outside," said Dwivedi. The administration warned of action if the dress code is violated.

291.title: UN calls for safety zone around Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant
291.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) urged Russia and Ukraine to establish a "nuclear safety and security protection zone" around the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant. "We're playing with fire...something very, very catastrophic could take place," Rafael Grossi, Director General of the IAEA warned. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres urged both sides to agree on a "demilitarised perimeter".

292.title: Rupee falls to 79.88 as dollar returns to a 20-year high of 110.6
292.article_body: The rupee lowered by four paise on Wednesday to 79.88 against the US dollar from its previous close as the latter returned to a 20-year high of 110.6. The dollar index, which gauges the American currency against yen, pound, euro, franc, Canadian dollar and krona, surged as much as 0.5%. The Brent crude futures fell 1.33% to $91.60 per barrel.

293.title: Railway official assaulted by 2 ticketless passengers in Gujarat
293.article_body: A Deputy Chief Ticket Inspector of the Western Railway (WR) was assaulted by two persons travelling without tickets in a passenger train near Bilimora station in Gujarat on Tuesday. They attacked the official, MM Qazi, after refusing to pay a fine. They also stole a mobile phone and cash from Qazi, said a WR officer.

294.title: Video shows Putin watching military drills attended by Indian, Chinese forces
294.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday oversaw military drills in his country's far east, donning his military uniform. A video showed Putin attending the drills along with Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu and military Chief of Staff Valery Gerasimov. The military exercises, called Vostok 2022, involve more than 50,000 troops from India, China and several other countries.

295.title: Bengaluru Police shares traffic advisory as some parts of city remain waterlogged
295.article_body: The Bengaluru Police shared traffic advisory on Wednesday as some parts of Bengaluru continued to remain waterlogged. As per the advisory, near Ecospace of Outer Ring Road only heavy vehicle movement was allowed from Marathahalli towards Silk Board while traffic movement was blocked on Channasandra Road till waterlogging is cleared. Meanwhile, slow traffic movement was reported on Belathur Road.

296.title: Punjab government yet to clear salaries of its employees for August: Reports
296.article_body: Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government is yet to clear the salaries of its employees for the month of August, as per reports. The government had reportedly been facing a financial crunch since the GST compensation regime came to an end. "The delay was due to...government investing ₹1,000 crore to make money as interest for the state exchequer," an official said.

297.title: Diversity has intrinsic worth, furthers our understanding of fairness: SC judge
297.article_body: Diversity results in innovative thinking, decision-making and richness in the originality of scholarly thought, SC judge Justice DY Chandrachud said. On the aspect of diversity, Justice Chandrachud said, "An intrinsic worth in itself...furthers our understanding of fairness and social justice." "Learning is impoverished when it happens in groups of like-minded people," he added.

298.title: Delhi's ban on firecrackers to continue this Diwali, online sale of crackers also banned
298.article_body: Delhi Government has extended the ban on manufacturing, storing, sale and bursting of firecrackers in continuation of last year's directive. Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai said that use of all types of firecrackers is being completely banned so that people's lives can be saved from pollution. This year, Delhi government has also banned the online sale and delivery of firecrackers.

299.title: Superhero films worldwide have high budgets, we don't have such budgets: Rakesh
299.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan, speaking about 'Krrish 4', has said that the film has a big budget and the scripting is almost done. However, he added, "The challenge for me is that in today's..age, people...watch superhero films from all over the world." Rakesh said, "These superhero films are made on very big budgets. And we don't have such big budgets."

300.title: 51% of school students face problems in learning online: NCERT survey
300.article_body: As many as 51% of school students face difficulty in learning online, as per a survey on the mental health and well-being of students conducted by the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT). Over 33% comply with peer pressure most of the time, it added. Over 45% are not satisfied with their body image, the survey stated.

301.title: Apple to appeal Brazil govt's sales ban of iPhone without charger
301.article_body: After the Brazilian government on Tuesday ordered Apple to stop selling iPhones without a battery charger in the country, the company said it will appeal the order. It also said it would continue to work with Brazilian consumer protection agency SENACON to "resolve their concerns". Apple was fined 12.275 million reais (around ₹19 crore) by the Brazilian Justice Ministry.

302.title: Pune RTI activist booked for blackmailing ex-corporator's husband
302.article_body: An RTI activist, identified as Jitendra Ashok Bhosale from Pune, has been booked for allegedly blackmailing and trying to extort money from a former corporator's husband. According to police, Bhosale demanded ₹25 lakh from Arjun Jagtap, threatening him of exposing his alleged involvement in illegal construction. He allegedly threatened to defame Jagtap and his wife before civic polls.

303.title: India reports 5,379 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases at 50,594
303.article_body: India has reported 5,379 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours and 27 more deaths, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 4,417 COVID-19 cases, the lowest since June 2022. Active cases in the country dropped to 50,594, while the daily positivity rate stood at 1.67%.

304.title: Man in Mercedes picks up subsidised food items from govt shop in Punjab; video viral
304.article_body: A viral video shows a man in a Mercedes taking subsidised food items from a government ration shop in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. The ration is available at these shops for Below Poverty Line (BPL) people who can't afford to buy it from a grocery store. The driver later said that it was his relative's car who does not live in India.

305.title: Ratan Tata's 92-year-old stepmother Simone Tata attends Cyrus Mistry's funeral
305.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was cremated at the Worli crematorium in central Mumbai on Tuesday.  Industry doyen Ratan Tata's 92-year-old stepmother Simone Tata was also present at the funeral. Wheelchair-bound Simone Tata arrived at the crematorium in a special van. However, no other senior official from the Tata Group attended the funeral.

306.title: Registry of 5 illegal flats to be cancelled in Gurugram's Palam Vihar
306.article_body: Gurugram Deputy Commissioner on Tuesday directed to cancel registration of five illegally constructed flats in Palam Vihar's C2 block. "Around 30 flats, built in violation of rules, were sealed on Monday. The owner of one of the plots on which multiple dwelling units were built broke the seal and resumed construction," a Department of Town and Country Planning official said.

307.title: 7,000 sq m plot allotted for Lata Mangeshkar music college in Mumbai
307.article_body: The Maharashtra government has allocated a 7,000 square metres plot to set up an international music college in the name of late singer Lata Mangeshkar. The college will be established in the Kalina campus of the University of Mumbai. It will be called Bharat Ratna Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar International College of Music and Museum.

308.title: Pune man kills grandmother, dumps body parts in river over property
308.article_body: A 20-year-old man killed her 62-year-old grandmother and chopped her body into pieces before dumping them into a river over a property dispute in Pune, said police on Tuesday. The accused, Guddu Gaikwad, planned the murder with his father. According to police, the victim, who owned a house and some gold ornaments, had refused to give money to his grandson.

309.title: Instagram will remove shopping page, other features: Report
309.article_body: Instagram is reportedly planning to roll back several of its shopping features. In an internal memo to the staff, the company stated that the existing shopping page will eventually disappear due to "shifts in company priorities". It added that over the next few months, Instagram will test a less personalised version of the shopping page, called 'Tab Lite'.

310.title: Wanted to be part of 'Ponniyin Selvan', Mani Ratnam denied it: Rajinikanth
310.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth revealed that he wanted to be a part of Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan'. "I asked Mani sir if I can play Periya Pazhuvettaraiyar. He denied the offer saying my fans would not be happy," he said. Rajinikanth added, "Anyone else would have taken it, but Mani denied it and this is what makes him unique!"

311.title: Mumbai reports 0 COVID-19 deaths for 1st time in 15 days
311.article_body: Mumbai did not report a single death linked to COVID-19 for the first time in about 15 days i.e. since August 22 on Tuesday and the death toll remained at 19,711, according to BMC. The city recorded 285 new infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 11,46,725 cases. As many as 516 patients recovered from the infection.

312.title: Pune-based institute signs MoU with DIAT to promote naturopathy
312.article_body: Pune-based National Institute of Naturopathy (NIN) has signed an MoU with Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DIAT), a DRDO-funded university, to promote naturopathy treatment. Under the agreement, an out-patient department will be set up and yoga sessions will be conducted at DIAT. "There is an increasing demand for naturopathy and yoga," said NIN Director Professor K Satya Lakshmi.

313.title: Mumbai to witness light rainfall, thundershowers for next 48 hrs: IMD
313.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall in Mumbai and suburbs for the next 48 hours. There is also a possibility of thundershowers with temperatures expected to hover around 26°C to 31°C, IMD added. According to IMD official Sushma Nair, long-term observations indicate better rainfall in September than what the city saw in August.

314.title: When Bumrah, Axar & Shami are back, India will have edge: Gavaskar
314.article_body: After India's two consecutive defeats in the ongoing Asia Cup, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said India must play their World Cup team in the upcoming T20 series against Australia and South Africa. "When Bumrah, Axar and Shami [are] back, India will have a sharper edge...But we want them now to get more overs under their belt," he added.

315.title: Vedant Patel becomes 1st Indian-American to hold daily US State Dept presser
315.article_body: Vedant Patel, Principal Deputy Spokesperson for US State Department, on Tuesday created history by becoming the first Indian-American to hold the daily State Department news conference. Patel was filling in for State Department Spokesperson Ned Price, who's on a vacation. Patel held the presser with "utmost professionalism", Matt Hill, White House's Senior Associate Communications Director, said.

316.title: CBI raids West Bengal Law Minister Moloy Ghatak's 6 premises in coal scam case
316.article_body: CBI officials are conducting raids at six premises of West Bengal Law Minister Moloy Ghatak in connection with the coal scam case. While five premises are in Kolkata, one is in Asansol. CBI has alleged that illegal coal mining was done near Asansol and transactions of ₹1,300 crore were allegedly done, the bulk of which went to several influential people.

317.title: Musk's lawyer seeks to delay Twitter trial to investigate whistleblower's claims
317.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyer urged that the trial over the $44 billion Twitter deal should be delayed by several weeks to allow Musk to investigate a whistleblower's claims. "Doesn't justice demand a few weeks to look into this?" said Musk’s lawyer. Twitter's former head of security, Peiter Zatko, accused Twitter of falsely claiming it had a solid security plan.

318.title: Google to launch its 1st smartwatch, Pixel 7 phones on October 6
318.article_body: Google on Tuesday announced that it will launch Pixel 7, Pixel 7 Pro and its first smartwatch Pixel Watch during its 'Made by Google' event on October 6. It first gave a sneak peek of these products during its I/O event. Pixel 7 phones will run on Android 13 and feature the next generation of Google's custom mobile chip, Tensor.

319.title: Cong should start 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Pakistan, India is united: Assam CM
319.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday said that India is connected and united, so Congress’ Rahul Gandhi should start the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Pakistan. "India was divided in 1947 during Congress...What are the benefits of doing this yatra in India?" Sarma asked. His statement came a day before the launch of Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

320.title: Couple killed, child injured over domestic dispute in East Delhi
320.article_body: A man and his wife died following an alleged stabbing incident in East Delhi's Guru Angad Nagar area on Tuesday. The couple has two children, including a 13-year-old boy who also sustained injuries. He was later admitted to hospital for treatment. According to police, the incident took place over an alleged marital dispute. Further investigation is underway, police added.

321.title: Sensex falls 400 points, Nifty below 17,600 in opening trade
321.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red on Wednesday amid weak global cues. The Sensex fell 400 points to open at 58,800, while the Nifty lost 126 points to open at 17,528.90. Bharti Airtel, IndusInd Bank, ONGC, RIL and HDFC were among the major losers, while stocks of HUL, Dr Reddy's, Nestle India and Shree Cement gained.

322.title: Bajrang Dal stops Ranbir, Alia from entering Ujjain temple over actor's beef comments
322.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt were stopped on Tuesday from entering the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga temple in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain by Bajrang Dal workers over the actor's past comments on eating beef. Videos of police cane charging the protesters surfaced online. Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt were at the temple to offer prayers ahead of the release of their film 'Brahmastra'.

323.title: Casting will be locked later: Basu on rumours of Jennifer being in Aashiqui 3
323.article_body: 'Aashiqui 3' director Anurag Basu has reacted to rumours of actress Jennifer Winget being cast in the film along with actor Kartik Aaryan. "Well, I've been also hearing about these rumours. However, honestly, we're currently at a very nascent stage. We're currently ideating about various other aspects of film-making," he stated. Anurag added, "Casting will be locked later on."

324.title: I was thinking of bowling Hooda, but SL's right-handers batted for long: Rohit
324.article_body: After Sri Lanka chased down India's 174-run target in their Asia Cup Super 4 match on Tuesday, India captain Rohit Sharma said he was thinking of bowling Deepak Hooda to take advantage of the bigger boundary, but it didn't work out as Sri Lanka's right-handers batted for very long. "In the end, SL held their nerves quite well," added Rohit.

325.title: More rain to hit Bengaluru in next three hours: IMD
325.article_body: A thunderstorm with lightning and light to moderate rain is expected in urban and rural regions of Bengaluru in the next three hours, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "Widespread rains for next five days in coastal and north interior Karnataka, three days of widespread rains...in the next two days in south interior Karnataka," an IMD scientist said on Tuesday.

326.title: Rahul pays tribute to Rajiv Gandhi in Sriperumbudur ahead of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
326.article_body: Ahead of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday attended a prayer gathering at the memorial of his father and ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi in Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu. He paid floral tribute at his father’s memorial. "I lost my father to politics of hate and division. I will not lose my beloved country to it too," Rahul tweeted.

327.title: Malicious attempt to disparage education system: Jamiat on madrassas' survey
327.article_body: UP government's move to conduct a survey of madrassas in the state is a "malicious attempt" to disparage this education system, Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind said on Tuesday. "Madrassas are very beneficial. This system, provided to us by our elders, is unparalleled worldwide, so it will be safeguarded at all costs," the Jamiat quoted its President Maulana Mahmood Asad Madani as saying.

328.title: 1981 Indian Airlines hijacker Gajinder reveals his Pakistan location in Facebook post
328.article_body: Gajinder Singh, a hijacker of a 1981 Indian Airlines flight, has revealed his location in Pakistan in a Facebook post on Monday. Singh was seen standing in front of Panja Sahib Gurudwara at Hasan Abdal in Pakistan's province of Punjab. The flight carrying over 100 passengers to Amritsar was forcibly diverted to Lahore.

329.title: Car in Mistry's accident had 7 past cases of speeding & jumping signals: Police
329.article_body: The Mercedes SUV in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed, is now known to have at least seven traffic violation cases of speeding and jumping signals from 2020 till now, said the police. However, the police are yet to ascertain who was behind the wheel at the time of these offences. Mistry's accident took place in Palghar.

330.title: Karnataka Forest Minister Umesh Katti dies of heart attack aged 61
330.article_body: Karnataka Forest and Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs Minister Umesh Katti died of heart attack aged 61 on Tuesday. "I've lost a very close friend of mine...It's a huge loss...He has left a huge vacuum which is very difficult to fill up," CM Basavaraj Bommai said. Katti collapsed at his Bengaluru home and was rushed to a hospital.

331.title: Save us from bicycle thieves: Mumbai's Dabbawalas tell Dy CM
331.article_body: The Mumbai Dabbawala Association has written a formal complaint to Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis, asking for security for their cycles parked at railway stations after several cases of theft were reported. In three days, six bicycles of Dabbawalas have been stolen from outside railway stations. "Each cycle costs around ₹10,000,'' said Mumbai Dabbawala Association's President.

332.title: Indian batsmen came hard, but we did well to keep them to 173: Dasun Shanaka
332.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said their batting unit won it for them against India in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match on Tuesday. "The Indian batsmen came hard, but we did well to keep them to 173...We know what we can do in this tournament," he added. Sri Lanka chased down India's 174-run target in 19.5 overs.

333.title: Will surely see Xi at G20 summit if Chinese Prez attends it: Biden
333.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday said that he would "surely see" Xi Jinping at the November G20 summit in Indonesia if his Chinese counterpart attends it. Biden and Xi previously discussed the possible meeting during their July 28 phone call, which took place amid heightened tensions over US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi's trip to Taiwan.

334.title: 16-year-old Class 10 girl student killed in hit-and-run case in Pune
334.article_body: A 16-year-old Class 10 girl was killed in a hit-and-run case in Pune's Khadki, officials said. The deceased, a resident of Pathare Vasti in Lohegaon, was hit by a dumper on Monday afternoon while riding her bicycle, officials added. The accident took place when the victim was going to tuition class after her school, officials stated.

335.title: ED arrests former NSE CEO Ravi Narain in money laundering case
335.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested Ravi Narain, the former Managing Director and CEO of the National Stock Exchange (NSE), in connection with a money laundering case related to the alleged illegal phone-tapping of the exchange's employees. The ED had earlier arrested another former NSE MD and CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and former Mumbai Commissioner of Police Sanjay Pandey in the case.

336.title: Delhi govt to decongest 77 traffic hotspots: CM Arvind Kejriwal
336.article_body: Delhi government has decided to decongest 77 traffic hotspots in the national capital, CM Arvind Kejriwal said. "We will redesign roads and construct flyovers...foot overbridges to rid Delhiites of traffic snarls," he added. In February 2017, a task force constituted by the Lieutenant Governor identified 77 road corridors in Delhi for implementing measures to tackle severe traffic congestion.

337.title: ByteDance fires hundreds of employees from video gaming division: Report
337.article_body: TikTok's parent company ByteDance has reportedly fired hundreds of employees from its video gaming division in Hong Kong. According to a report, ByteDance is also cutting jobs at Jiangnan Studio, its game development studio in the Hangzhou district. Earlier in June, ByteDance shut down a game development studio and fired more than 100 employees.

338.title: Woman bites off mother-in-law's fingers in fight over TV volume in Thane
338.article_body: A 60-year-old woman was allegedly bitten on three fingers of her right hand by her daughter-in-law in a fight over television volume in Thane. The incident reportedly took place on Monday night. According to police, the duo is always involved in fights over petty issues. A case has been registered against the daughter-in-law at Shivaji Nagar police station, police added.

339.title: Goan-origin Suella Braverman appointed as UK's new Home Secretary
339.article_body: Goan-origin Suella Braverman, the Conservative Party member of Parliament for Fareham in south-east England, was on Tuesday appointed as UK's new Home Secretary. Braverman, who was a candidate for UK Prime Minister, dropped out in the second round in July and supported Liz Truss instead. Suella, a Cambridge University law graduate, married Rael Braverman in 2018.

340.title: Burning Man Festival at US desert ends with 8-hour traffic jam; pics go viral
340.article_body: The nine-day Burning Man Festival in US' Nevada came to an end on Monday. Those leaving from the venue in the Black Rock desert found themselves stuck in an eight-hour-long traffic jam, with many experiencing fuel shortages at stations along the way. Pictures showing the traffic jam went viral on social media.

341.title: 7 monkeys killed, their bodies dumped outside village in UP
341.article_body: Some people killed seven monkeys and threw their bodies outside Gura Barela village in Uttar Pradesh on Monday, police said. "A video, which shows the monkeys with their hands tied and black oil on their eyes, has...gone viral," Divisional Forest Officer Ashok Kumar said. The bodies of the monkeys have been sent to the Indian Veterinary Research Institute for post-mortem.

342.title: Nitish, Tejashwi to attend INLD rally; Sharad Pawar also invited
342.article_body: Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) leader Abhay Chautala confirmed that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and his deputy Tejashwi Yadav will attend the party's rally on September 25 in Haryana. NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Farooq Abdullah and Akhilesh Yadav have also been invited, Chautala said. Telangana CM Chandrashekar Rao and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee will also be invited, he added.

343.title: MP's Kuno National Park to get 7 helipads for cheetah reintroduction
343.article_body: Kuno National Park (KNP) in MP's Sheopur district will see the construction of at least seven helipads in and around its vicinity to carry out the cheetah reintroduction project. Under this project, cheetahs will be brought from South Africa and Namibia to the national park. South Africa is yet to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) draft for exporting cheetahs.

344.title: Rahul known for 'Bharat Chodo': BJP leader on Cong's 'Bharat Jodo' Yatra
344.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai on Tuesday criticised Congress' upcoming 'Bharat Jodo' (uniting India) Yatra and said that Kerala Congress MP Rahul Gandhi is more famous for 'Bharat Chodo' (leaving India). Gandhi is scheduled to launch the yatra in Tamil Nadu's southern Kanniyakumari district on September 7. The five-month-long yatra will pass through 12 states and culminate in Kashmir.

345.title: US military to test launch an ICBM on Wednesday, Russia notified
345.article_body: The US military will test launch an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) on Wednesday, the Pentagon said. Russia has been notified of the upcoming launch, the Pentagon added. The US last month carried out the test launch of the Minuteman III ICBM after initially putting it off to avoid escalation in tensions with China.

346.title: Thousands protest hike in fuel prices in Indonesia
346.article_body: Thousands protested across Indonesian cities on Tuesday, demanding the government roll back the increase in fuel prices. Student and labour groups demonstrated in Jakarta, Surabaya, Makassar, Kendari, Aceh, and Yogyakarta as police said they expect protests to intensify. Over the weekend, Indonesian President Joko Widodo announced a cut in fuel subsidies that would increase prices by 30%.

347.title: Germany planning to drop mandatory mask rule on flights
347.article_body: The German government is planning to drop the mandatory mask rule on flights to and from the country. The present rules mandate masks to be worn on flights till September 23.
