The Free Democratic Party has demanded that the rule be dropped. Health Minister Karl Lauterbach said the mask rule could be re-imposed if coronavirus cases rise sharply.

348.title: Belarus plans law to revoke citizenship over 'extremism'
348.article_body: The Belarusian government is in the process of drafting legislation that will allow it to revoke the citizenship of Belarusians living abroad if found indulging in "extremism", interior minister of Belarus said on Tuesday. He added that such individuals would be handed a 30-year entry ban. Notably, several exiled opposition leaders have been declared "terrorists" by the Belarusian government.

349.title: Adriana Lima welcomes third child, names him Cyan
349.article_body: Model-actor Adriana Lima announced that she gave birth to her third child on August 29. Sharing a close-up of her son's eye on Instagram, Lima wrote, "Cyan now is our favorite color... the color of our baby boy's eyes. Welcome to our world CYAN LIMA LEMMERS". Cyan is Lima's first baby with boyfriend Andre Lemmers.

350.title: AAP boycotts EC's all-party meeting in Jammu, terms it a 'joke'
350.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) boycotted Election Commission's (EC) all-party meeting and staged a protest outside its Jammu office on Monday. Calling the meeting a "joke", AAP's Harsh Dev Singh said that suggestions made by the Opposition aren't paid heed to, adding that only BJP's decisions are implemented. "BJP doesn't want an end to its proxy rule in J&K," he added.

351.title: UP Cabinet approves ₹192 cr aid to help farmers prevent crop damage
351.article_body: The CM Yogi Adityanath-led UP Cabinet has approved ₹192.57 crore in aid for farmers facing challenges crop damage challenges. The money will be used to control weeds in the field and for the safe storage of ready crops by using ecological resources over the next five years. Another proposal for a 50% subsidy on storage units was also approved.

352.title: Lufthansa pilots call off strike after reaching deal in wage dispute
352.article_body: Pilots of German airlines Lufthansa have called off their second strike scheduled for this week after reaching a deal in their wage dispute with the company. The Vereinigung Cockpit (VC) pilots' union said that they had reached a deal on a comprehensive package and are yet to discuss details of the agreement. The strike was due to begin on Wednesday.

353.title: Over 700 children died in Somalian care centres this year: UNICEF
353.article_body: Over 700 children died in nutrition centres across Somalia this year, the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) said on Tuesday. Nutrition centres care for children who suffer from acute malnutrition. "This is less than 1% of the children who were admitted, cured and discharged... (but) this number could be more, as many deaths...go unreported," said a UNICEF official.

354.title: Holiday Inn-owner IHG's tech system hit by 'unauthorised activity'
354.article_body: The owner of Holiday Inn, IHG said that its technology systems were hit by 'unauthorised activity' which disrupted the bookings on its apps and website. IHG said it has hired external specialists for the investigation, and is currently notifying the regulatory bodies. The company said that it has implemented a response plan and is assessing the impact of the incident.

355.title: Indian men's hockey team is focussing on every aspect of game: Rohidas
355.article_body: Indian men's hockey team defender Amit Rohidas said that his side is looking forward to the new season of FIH Hockey Pro League, beginning October 28. "It's a new challenge and a new opportunity for us," he added. "From defending to finishing along with our fitness, we are currently focussing on every aspect of the game," he further said.

356.title: SC issues notice to UP govt on Ashish Mishra's bail plea
356.article_body: The Supreme Court has issued a notice to the Uttar Pradesh government over Ashish Mishra's bail plea, in connection to the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. Mishra is facing a murder case for the October 3, 2021 incident in which eight people including four farmers were killed in Lakhimpur Kheri. The Allahabad High Court dismissed Mishra's bail plea on July 26.

357.title: Govt gives coal plants 2 more years to install emissions equipment
357.article_body: The Centre has extended its deadline for coal-fired power plants by two years to install equipment to cut sulphur emissions. Initially, a 2017 deadline was set to install flue gas desuphurisation (FGD) to reduce emissions and last year it was extended to 2025. As per the new order, power plants will be forcibly retired if they don't comply by 2027.

358.title: India lose to SL in T20 Asia Cup for 1st time, virtually out of race to reach final
358.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated India by six wickets in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match on Tuesday. This is India's first defeat against Sri Lanka in T20 Asia Cup history. With the defeat, India are virtually out of race to reach the final of Asia Cup 2022 after having earlier lost to Pakistan in the Super 4 stage.

359.title: One of the best of his generation: Mbappe on 22-year-old Vlahovic
359.article_body: Calling 22-year-old Dusan Vlahovic a quality striker, Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) forward Kylian Mbappe said the Juventus striker is one of the best of his generation. "He can do much better going forward, he has so much to give," he added. "He has already shown so much...He will be a top striker in the coming years," Mbappe further said.

360.title: Porsche won't become a shareholder: Red Bull confirms F1 deal off
360.article_body: Red Bull F1 advisor Helmut Marko revealed the team's talks for a deal with Porsche have collapsed. Rumours claimed Porsche was looking to enter F1 in 2026 by buying a 50% stake in Red Bull and becoming an engine manufacturer. The deal broke down as Porsche reportedly wanted a greater say in the team and Red Bull upped their price.

361.title: Scholarship declared for descendants of Indians martyred in B'desh war
361.article_body: Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina on Tuesday announced the Mujib Scholarship for direct descendants of Indian soldiers killed or grievously injured in the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War. As many as 200 family members of Indian Army personnel will reportedly receive the scholarship, which will be conferred on Wednesday. A total of 1,984 Indian Army personnel were reportedly killed in the war.

362.title: Police destroy 35 kg IED which it recovered in J&K; video emerges
362.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police recovered an improvised explosive device (IED) weighing around 30-35 kg from an orchard on the outskirts of Srinagar on Tuesday. The IED was recovered after police received input regarding presence of militants in Khonmoh. A video showed a cloud of smoke and dust in a forest area after police destroyed the IED through a controlled explosion.

363.title: 'PS-1' is coming together of Rahman & Mani Ratnam's talent: Aishwarya
363.article_body: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan said 'Ponniyin Selvan Part One' is the "incredible coming together of iconic talents AR Rahman and Mani Ratnam". "I had the privilege of working with them at the beginning of my career- this talented duo, with Iruvar, and here I am again, as part of Ponniyin Selvan," she said. Aishwarya plays Queen Nandini in the film.

364.title: We thought 'Bhabi Ji…' wouldn't last for more than 3 months: Rohitashv
364.article_body: Television actor Rohitashv Gour said the team of 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' didn't think that the show would run for more than three months. The actor said the show, which is now in its eighth year, worked because of its pure comedy. He praised the writers for "evolving and bringing up new creative ideas to keep the audiences hooked".

365.title: Harmanpreet nominated for FIH Player of Year Award
365.article_body: Indian hockey player Harmanpreet Singh was named among five nominees for the FIH Men's Player of the Year award. Meanwhile, PR Sreejesh and Savita Punia were shortlisted for the best male and female goalkeeper awards for the FIH Hockey Stars Awards 2021-22. Notably, all three, Harmanpreet, Savita and Sreejesh, won the awards last year as well.

366.title: After dispute with husband, woman sets 3-yr-old son afire in Ludhiana
366.article_body: After dispute with husband, a woman allegedly set her three-year-old son afire at her parents' house in a village in Punjab's Ludhiana district. The police booked the woman, Rupinder Kaur, on charges of attempt to murder based on the complaint of her mother, Manjit Kaur. The boy is undergoing treatment at a Chandigarh-based hospital and is stated to be critical.

367.title: Video shows aurora lights above Earth's atmosphere after solar storm hits Earth
367.article_body: A video shows aurora lights over the Earth's atmosphere. "This time-lapse video shows an orbital pass above an aurora-draped Indian Ocean all the way to a moonlit Coral Sea east of Australia," the caption read. The video was shot after a stream of solar wind struck the Earth and sparked a geomagnetic storm, which produced an aurora in some regions.

368.title: Milind Soman & Ankita trek up to 17,000 ft in Ladakh; share pics
368.article_body: Milind Soman and his wife Ankita Konwar were in Ladakh where the two completed "a trek of 55 kms to climb up to 17,000 feet and back" in four days. Sharing a video that featured herself with Milind, Ankita wrote that she learnt a lot and is "forever grateful". In his earlier post, Milind described Ladakh as beautiful and spiritual.

369.title: Never wanted to work with Khans, just Amitabh Bachchan: Ekta Kapoor
369.article_body: Producer Ekta Kapoor said she always "dreamt of working with" Amitabh Bachchan. "I don't think I had ever wanted to work with anyone, no Khans or anyone else, just Mr Amitabh Bachchan. Finally, it happened," she said at the trailer launch of 'Goodbye'. Talking about the Vikas Bahl directorial, Ekta said her experience of working on the film was different.

370.title: Dwayne Johnson surprises fans at Black Adam's test screening
370.article_body: Dwayne Johnson surprised his fans at the test screening of 'Black Adam'. The actor, who shared a video on his Instagram account, said he took some "invaluable learnings" from his "#1 boss- the audience". Talking about the DC film, Johnson said it is his "passion project to the bone" and he is "grateful" to have received the audience's early reactions.

371.title: I don't know when I am going to come back: Rafael Nadal after US Open exit
371.article_body: After crashing out of US Open 2022 in the round of 16, former world number one Rafael Nadal said, "I don't know when I am going to come back." "I have to go home, I have more important things than tennis to attend to," he added. He further said that his personal life comes before his professional life.

372.title: Streets of Anbuden will never forget what Chinna Thala meant to us: CSK on Raina
372.article_body: Reacting to Suresh Raina announcing his retirement, CSK tweeted, "The streets of Anbuden will never forget what Chinna Thala meant to each and every one of us!" CSK added, "Thank You, Mr. IPL! #ChinnaThalaForever." Raina played a total of 205 matches in IPL, scoring 5,528 runs. He slammed one hundred and 39 fifties in IPL.

373.title: Let's keep cricket free from personal attacks: Sachin after Arshdeep got abused online
373.article_body: After Arshdeep Singh got abused online for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Every athlete representing the country gives their best and plays for the nation always. They need our constant support & remember...in sports you win some & you lose some." He added, "Let's keep cricket or any other sport free from personal attacks."

374.title: World's most powerful telescope captures star-forming region 'Tarantula Nebula'
374.article_body: NASA on Tuesday said its James Webb Space Telescope (world's most powerful telescope) has captured the 'Tarantula Nebula' with thousands of never-before-seen young stars visible in the new image. The nebula is located 1,61,000 light-years in the Large Magellanic Cloud galaxy. It is the largest and brightest star-forming region in the galaxy group located closest to the Milky Way.

375.title: Kangana Ranaut's 'Tejas' release postponed: Reports
375.article_body: The release date of Kangana Ranaut-starrer 'Tejas' has been postponed, as per reports. "Tejas was to release in October. However...there's still quite a bit of work pending [with VFX]," a source was quoted as saying. "The makers are looking at a release in either December 2022 or January 2023," the source added. 'Tejas' is written and directed by Sarvesh Mewara.

376.title: The Banshees of Inisherin gets 13-minute standing ovation at Venice
376.article_body: Colin Farrell's 'The Banshees of Inisherin' received a 13-minute standing ovation at its Venice Film Festival premiere, which is said to be the longest and loudest reception for any film this season. The film reunites Farrell with director Martin McDonagh and co-actor Brendan Gleeson after 'In Bruges' (2008). It will also premiere at Toronto International Film Festival this week.

377.title: Murder suspect attacked in Chennai court; gang rivalry suspected
377.article_body: Five men attempted to kill a murder suspect named Madurai Bala with weapons including knives inside the premises of a court in Chennai on Monday. A man also emptied a can of pepper into Bala's face. Policemen escorting Bala arrested three of the attackers, while two men escaped. Police suspect internal gang rivalry as the reason for the attack.

378.title: BSF seizes ₹3 lakh in Pak currency from Kartarpur Sahib returnees
378.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) has seized ₹3 lakh in Pakistani currency from a man and his grandmother who had returned from Gurdwara Darbar Sahib in Kartarpur, the police said. They added that they found 100 notes of ₹1,000 denomination, totalling ₹1 lakh and the rest were ₹5,000 notes. This was their second visit to the gurdwara.

379.title: South Africa announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
379.article_body: South Africa on Tuesday announced their 15-member squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Temba Bavuma will lead the squad, which also includes Quinton De Kock, Keshav Maharaj, David Miller, Wayne Parnell and Anrich Nortje. Rassie van der Dussen has not been included in the squad due to injury, while Tristan Stubbs will be making his T20 World Cup debut.

380.title: Still gravely concerned: IAEA on Ukrainian nuclear plant
380.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has released a report on the situation in the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine, which is in the middle of the war zone. "The IAEA is still gravely concerned about the situation...(but) hasn't found any indication that would give rise to a proliferation concern," it read. The nuclear plant is under Russian control.

381.title: 2021 semi-finalist Sabalenka beats US' Collins to enter US Open quarters
381.article_body: Last year's semi-finalist Aryna Sabalenka of Belarus beat US' Danielle Collins 3-6, 6-3, 6-2 in the fourth round at US Open 2022 on Monday. She'll now face Czech Karolina Pliskova in the quarter-final. On facing 2016 finalist Pliskova, Sabalenka said, "It's going to be tough." The 22nd-seeded Czech defeated 26th-seeded Victoria Azarenka 7-5, 6-7(5-7), 6-2 in the last 16.

382.title: Matter of serious concern: SC on cases under Section 66A of IT Act
382.article_body: The Supreme Court said that it is a 'matter of serious concern' that cases and FIRs were being registered under Section 66A of the IT Act, despite scrapping it in 2015. The court directed all state Chief Secretaries to take remedial measures against the use of the Act. In 2015, the Supreme Court called the Act 'vague and arbitrary'.

383.title: Man kills wife in Rajasthan; goes later to file her missing complaint
383.article_body: A man allegedly strangulated his 22-year-old wife to death and buried her body in a field in Birawai village in Rajasthan's Bharatpur. The accused, Pintu (26), then walked to the police station to file her missing complaint. The body of the deceased, Krishna, was exhumed from the field, police said. The exact reason behind the murder is still unknown.

384.title: I'd believe Paul Pogba over his brother: Mbappe on blackmail plot
384.article_body: PSG forward Kylian Mbappe said he would believe his teammate Paul Pogba over his brother Mathias Pogba in the multi-million blackmail-extortion plot. "He called me and gave me his version of events. It is his word against his brother's," said Mbappe. Mathias had claimed that Paul had paid a witch doctor to cast a spell on his France teammate Mbappe.

385.title: J&K official ordered non-locals to be added to voters' list: Mufti
385.article_body: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti accused a Baramulla district official of ordering workers from outside the state and central security personnel to be enrolled in the voters' list. The official responded stating "nothing like that" has happened and asked her for proof. Political parties in Kashmir have accused the Election Commission of trying to enrol non-locals into the voters' list.

386.title: Will win Sharad Pawar's home turf Baramati in 2024: Maharashtra BJP
386.article_body: The Maharashtra BJP said it will ally with the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena to win the Baramati constituency, the home turf of NCP chief Sharad Pawar, in the 2024 elections. The NCP hit back and asked the BJP to stop "daydreaming". BJP also claimed the alliance would win more than 45 of the 48 Lok Sabha seats in Maharashtra.

387.title: Women, poor ignored by previous Cong govts: Himachal Pradesh CM
387.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur alleged that the Congress ignored the welfare and progress of all sections, especially women and the poor, despite remaining in power in the state. "The state has a road network of 39,354 kilometres which has become possible due to Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana. Major credit goes to former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee," he said.

388.title: Create isolation wards in jails for people with contagious diseases: Delhi HC
388.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed Inspector General of Prisons to ensure isolation medical wards are created in jails so there's no compelling need to release inmates on bail, who may be suffering from contagious diseases. The court passed the order after hearing an interim bail application moved by an accused in an NDPS Act case, suffering from Herpes.

389.title: PM to inaugurate MP cheetah reintroduction project on his birthday
389.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will be inaugurating the intercontinental cheetah translocation project at Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh on September 17. PM Modi will also be interacting with women of self-help groups in Sheopur district's Karahal. An Air Force helicopter is being arranged to transport the eight African cheetahs from Delhi to Kuno to ensure minimum fatigue for them.

390.title: German military resumes reconnaissance operations in Mali
390.article_body: The German military resumed its reconnaissance operations in Mali on Tuesday, three weeks after operations were suspended due to a spat with Mali's government over flight clearances. Around 1,000 German troops are stationed in Mali, primarily to conduct reconnaissance for UN peacekeeping mission MINUSMA. The mission was established in 2013 to support the battle against Islamist militants in Mali.

391.title: Said no to '3 Idiots' remake in South: Madhavan
391.article_body: Actor R Madhavan revealed that he rejected an offer to be a part of the South remake of his film '3 Idiots'. "It becomes very difficult to play the same thing all over again," he added. "I perform in the flow and then to analyse if I did as good as the original becomes too taxing for me," said Madhavan.

392.title: ED has given Sisodia clean chit in Delhi excise policy case: AAP
392.article_body: AAP said the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has given a "clean chit" to Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in the excise policy case. "ED carried out raids at various locations but did not come to Manish Sisodia's residence," said AAP, as justification for their claim. On Monday, the party claimed that CBI had given Sisodia a clean chit in the case.

393.title: Water is natural wealth: SC to Punjab, Haryana on Sutlej-Yamuna dispute
393.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday asked Punjab and Haryana to resolve their differences and arrive at a negotiated water sharing agreement regarding the 26-year-old Sutlej-Yamuna dispute. "Individuals of the state...cannot say that only I need water...Water is a natural wealth and must be shared," the SC said. The Punjab counsel said the state's new government is willing to cooperate.

394.title: 2 women killed as pavement over water tank collapses in Rajasthan
394.article_body: Two women, aged 35 and 70, were killed after falling into a water tank after the pavement collapsed in Rajasthan's Udaipur district on Tuesday, police said. The women had gathered at a religious place when the incident took place. Five women were injured and have been admitted to a local hospital for treatment.

395.title: New Spanish law gives labour benefits to domestic cleaners, carers
395.article_body: The Spanish government on Tuesday approved a law giving domestic cleaners and carers the right to unemployment benefits, among other job securities. Labour Minister Yolanda Díaz said this will benefit over 370,000 people, 95% of whom are women. Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez had earlier said the bill would "put an end to unacceptable injustice".

396.title: Adani Group says loans from public sector banks halved
396.article_body: After a CreditSights report called the Adani Group overleveraged, the conglomerate said that it has more than halved its loans from public sector banks. It added the net debt to Ebitda ratio of its companies has declined to 3.2 times from 7.6 times in last nine years. The group said it has a capital-management plan for all its portfolio companies.

397.title: Rihanna helps US restaurant staff clean up after staying late for dinner: Report
397.article_body: Rihanna recently helped tidy up a Michelin-starred restaurant in US after she and her friends asked staff to stay open past closing time, said a report. She was reportedly "seen helping the waitstaff clean up and push the bar stools back into place since she stayed so late". Rihanna had arrived at the restaurant with six friends, the report added.

398.title: Youth pours acid into girl's mouth, slits her throat for resisting rape in Andhra
398.article_body: A 14-year-old girl in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore was left in critical condition after a youth, who's related to her, attacked her with acid and slit her throat, police said. The accused attacked the girl in her house after she resisted his attempt to sexually assault her, multiple reports said. When she screamed, he slit her throat and fled, police said.

399.title: Doors of BJP 'permanently shut' on Nitish Kumar: Sushil Modi
399.article_body: Former Deputy CM of Bihar Sushil Kumar Modi said BJP's doors have been "permanently shut" on Nitish Kumar after he broke the alliance with BJP in Bihar. "Nitish Kumar has put chameleons to shame in changing colours," Sushil Modi said. He claimed that Kumar had felt "suffocated" in the 20 months he ran his government in alliance with RJD earlier.

400.title: Biocon sells 5.4% stake in research arm Syngene for over ₹1,220 cr
400.article_body: Biopharma company Biocon on Tuesday sold 5.4% stake in its research arm Syngene International for over ₹1,220 crore through an open market transaction, according to a report. The drugmaker and the promoter of Syngene International has sold a total of 21,789,164 shares in the company, the report said. The shares were sold at an average price of ₹560.04 each.
